items.title: Software Engineer, Backend - Remote at Numbrs () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Finance
Company size: 51-200 people

Job description

Responsibilities include but are not limited to designing, developing, deploying, supporting, monitoring and troubleshooting large scale micro-service based distributed systems with high transaction volume. Applicants are also expected to participate in after-hours work.

All candidates will have

  • a Bachelor's or higher degree in technical field of study
  • a minimum of five years experience designing, developing and troubleshooting large scale distributed systems
  • hands-on experience with highly concurrent production grade systems
  • excellent knowledge of at least one modern programming language, such as Go, Java, C++ and Scala
  • excellent troubleshooting and creative problem-solving abilities
  • excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills

Ideally, candidates will also have

  • experience with systems for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerised applications, such as Kubernetes and Mesos
  • experience with big data technologies, such as Kafka, Spark, Storm, Flink and Cassandra
  • experience with encryption and cryptography standards

Location: Remote

About Numbrs

Numbrs' focus is on developing products to manage banking transactions and assets. The platform provides banking services for the consumer, as well as the development and implementation of banking software towards financial institutions. We are currently looking for a Software Engineer, Backend - Remote, at the earliest possible start date, to strengthen our position in the industry.

What we offer

  • Technology - Only the most cutting-edge technologies are used and we are constantly innovating. Our technical architecture is based on the use of Microservices, a block chain technology, and a proprietary machine learning technology.
  • Self-development - We offer to our employees a clear career chances by offering an experts and manager career path that ensures equal development opportunities.
  • Work / life balance - Work/life balance is important to us, which is why we offer flexible work schedules.
  • Salary - We offer highly competitive salaries. Our salary formula adjusts to your experience and cost of living.

Benefits

free breakfast, lunch and snacks
coffee and drinks
pool and kicker
modern workplace
paid vacation

items.title: Cloud Engineer- Docker Infrastructure- Leading Open Source Company at Elastic () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Industry: Data & Analytics, Search, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 501-1k people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Elastic is building out our Elastic Cloud Team focusing on Elastic as a Service. This is a great opportunity to help lead our Cloud efforts and make an immediate impact to our strategy and implementation.

Our cloud product allows users to create new clusters or expand existing ones easily This product would be built on technologies such as OpenStack, AWS, Docker, and others to enable the Operations Teams to easily create and manage multiple Elastic Clusters.

Please include a short note as to why you are a fit for this role and what excites you about joining Elastic!

Job Duties

  • Continuously integrate and automate deployment of latest Elastic stack versions to the cloud infrastructure
  • Build and manage docker images for Elastic Stack components.
  • Work closely with the core infrastructure and SRE team to ship new features in our SaaS platform.
Qualifications
  • CS or MS Degree in Computer Science
  • 5+ years of object-oriented development with at least one of: Scala, Python, Java
  • Experience building CI/CD infrastructure using Docker.
  • Experience or ability to respond to operational issues
  • A self starter who with experience working across multiple technical teams and decision makers
Nice to have - experience using Kubernetes or Mesos

About Elastic

Elastic is the world's leading software provider for making structured and unstructured data usable in real time for search, logging, security, and analytics use cases. Founded in 2012 by the people behind the Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash open source projects, Elastic's global community has more than 80,000 members across 45 countries, and since its initial release. Elastic's products have achieved more than 100 million cumulative downloads. Today thousands of organizations, including Cisco, eBay, Dell, Goldman Sachs, Groupon, HP, Microsoft, Netflix, The New York Times, Uber, Verizon, Yelp, and Wikipedia, use the Elastic Stack, X-Pack, and Elastic Cloud to power mission-critical systems that drive new revenue opportunities and massive cost savings. Elastic is backed by more than $104 million in funding from Benchmark Capital, Index Ventures, and NEA; has headquarters in Amsterdam, the Netherlands, and Mountain View, California; and has over 400 employees in more than 30 countries around the world.

Additional Information

  • Competitive pay and benefits
  • Stock options
  • Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices
  • An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life
  • Passionate people building great products
  • Employees with a wide variety of interests
  • Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

Benefits

401k Matching Up to 6 % in US and Pensions in some other countries
Health Care Insurance
Vacation Time Determined By Location
Lunch and Breakfast in Most Offices
100% Remote work possible

items.title: Java Developer - ITStaff Technical Resources - Madison, WI
items.content:
Java Developer
ITStaff Technical Resources -Madison, WI
MUST BE ABLE TO WORK FOR ANY U.S. EMPLOYER WITHOUT RESTRICTION

Ability to work remote

About the Company

Our client is located in Madison, WI and has over 1,000 employees and revenue of approximately $100 million with approximately 65,000 customers across the U.S.

What are some of the great things about working for our client?

Ability to work from home/remote
A comprehensive benefits package, including health insurance and annual bonus
Personal time is valued. Employees receive paid holidays, sick leave, vacation, and FMLA
Paid employee volunteer time each year for community support work
Company donation to employee’s non-profit organization of choice for each hour of non-business hours volunteer work in the community
Sharing of the company financial status and long-range planning with employees
Company organized and sponsored annual events for employee communication, education,

and entertainment, including company meetings, holiday parties, cookouts, special event days, and other events
Employees in all departments may earn additional perks. These pluses include cash, prizes, gift certificates, and free trips
Company provided education about financial planning to employees at company-sponsored seminars.

As a Java full-stack developer, your role will include, but not be limited to, advanced configuration, development, implementation, testing, and deployment of web-based applications and integration of applications and data with company systems.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related
Driven to succeed, self-starter and a customer service mindset
Firm grasp of the software development life cycle
Certification (Web Development, Graphics or Software Development) is desired
Extensive experience in Java, SQL, HTML and JavaScript
Experience with source code tools, such as Git or Stash is desired
Experience with Jenkins is highly desired
Experience in all aspects of web application development, including graphic elements, organizational and navigational structure, layout, development, usability, creation of forms for ease-of-use and search engine optimization
Considerable development experience with Core Java and Microservices
Advanced knowledge of common design patterns
Knowledge of relational database structure and design using SQL Server or MySQL
Extensive experience working with Jira and Confluence or other similar tools
Skilled in technical troubleshooting and demonstrated problem solving skills
Experience developing software in an Agile environment
Excellent communication skills
Experience with version control tools, such as Subversion
Ability to think creatively with strong problem solving capabilities
Experience in the insurance or financial industries is desired

Responsibilities

Development and testing of web-based applications using PHP, JAVA and web-services
Creating prototypes, including design, site navigation, and content layout for web sites and applications
Participation in maintenance and updates to existing applications, including updating of content stored in tables to support rules-based delivery of web elements and data integration
Meeting project deadlines and support of existing software applications and critical issues, including possible support during non-business hours
Providing architectural guidance and design for new software and web applications, including overall organization and navigational structure
Ability to develop accurate development estimates
Code reviews and mentoring team members

items.title: BPM Lead Developer (Innovative Scala/Java/Angular User-Configurable Platform) at Primotus Division of CargoTel () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior, Lead, Manager
Industry: Business Process Optmization, Enterprise Software, Mobile Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

In a Nutshell

Primotus is developing a unique Enterprise scale, user-configurable hybrid mobile workflow platform, which will allow users to design entire systems - including drag-and-drop database, forms, entitlements, processes, mobile applications, business decisions, messages, reports, and even maps - with little to no developer support. The platform is flexible enough to be deployed for a myriad of business verticals.

We’re looking for an experienced BPM and Business Rules full-stack developer who will own everything related to BPM. And, someone who's interested in pushing BPM beyond Java. 

If you think you’re a good fit and are interested in building something highly configurable and really innovative, please shoot us an email.

Our Stack : Includes many of the most-desired technologies, including:

Backend:

  • BPMN (Java), DMN (Java)
  • Scala/Akka, Play Framework, Slick
  • Web Sockets
  • Kafka (event-based processing)
  • Postgres, ElasticSearch
  • Restful API

Frontend:

  • Angular, TypeScript, React, Ionic Mobile, Redux, PouchDB (mobile data store)
  • CSS3, Bootstrap
  • Protractor, Selenium (Unit, end-to-end, API and performance testing tools)

DevOps:

  • Jenkins 
  • GIT, GitHub
  • AWS

Our development team:

  • Is small and growing with 10 members, so you'll be a significant contributor. 
  • Is comprised of frontend and backend teams
  • Separates code into distinct modules and services
  • Uses JSON API for backend/frontend integration
  • Applies Agile programming and paired development methodology in 3-week sprints
  • Works in a virtual, paired-development environment

You’d be working on some of the following initiatives:

  • Extending Decision Management (Business Rules) module based on new DMN industry standard
  • Augmenting drag and drop BPMN modeler and adding new CMMN modeler and engine. 
  • Expanding BPM engine to support additional functions
  • Augmenting inbound and outbound streaming Message Builder 
  • Assisting analysts with complex BPM modeling
  • Developing/ingesting JSON RestfulAPIs
  • Working with team making key architecture and stack decisions
  • Coordinating with QA (Protractor, Selenium, etc)

If you think you’re a good fit and are interested in building something from the ground floor that's really innovative, please shoot us an email.

You're expected to have:

- 2+ years J2EE development
- 3+ years of BPM development experience with open source (Activiti, Camunda, JBPM) or other leading BPM platform (Appian, Pega, IBM)
- 2+ years BPM modeling experience
- 1+ years of Business Rules Management (BRMS) with open source (Drools) or other leading platform (ILOG, FICO)
- Designing, ingesting quality JSON RESTful services and payloads
- GIT source control experience
- Willingness to share knowledge and mentor team members

Nice to have some of the following:

- Activiti, Camunda, JBPM
- Case Management (CMMN)
- Decision Management Notation (DMN)
- Camel or Mule enterprise integration 
- UI/UX and architecture skills
- ElasticSearch
- BI visualization tools (i.e. D3, Highcharts, Kibana, Leaflet)
- Exposure to our backend platform consisting of Scala, Akka, Kafka
- Business Resource Planning or Machine Learning 
- Postgres 
- AngularJS
- Mobile application development (native or hybrid)

About Primotus Division of CargoTel

Primotus is a well-funded and stable development-stage company. Developers work remotely but we embrace paired development and sharing knowledge including "Lunch-N'-Learns".  We encourage developer creativity, provide a high-degree of flexibility, and don't put developers on the clock.  

Our yet-to-be-released web site http://primotus.com will be available later this week. 

Competitive salary and full benefits including medical, dental, 401k (including Primotus contributions), and flex time.

Benefits

vacation of holidays
medical and dental
flexible working hours
work at home

items.title: Senior Core Java Engineer - Geospatial Search at Elastic () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Data & Analytics, Search, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 501-1k people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Want to work for a company that's family oriented with great work/life balance. Send us a short note as to why you are a fit along with your resume!

At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats — we help people around the world do great things with their data. Elastic's products have achieved more than 100 million cumulative downloads. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.

Do you want to work on distributed geospatial search and analytics software which impacts the lives of millions of people? We are looking for excellent back-end Java engineers who love solving problems. We’re not interested in your previous job title. Instead, we want to collaborate with bright people with a good knowledge of Java and a desire to take on new challenges.

Our Engineering Philosophy

Engineering a highly complex distributed system that is easy to operate via elegantly designed APIs is a non-trivial effort. It requires solid software development skills, and more importantly, a sharp mind and the ability to think like a user. We also care deeply about giving you full ownership of what you’re working on. Our company fundamentally believes great minds achieve greatness when they are set free and are surrounded and challenged by their peers, which is clearly visible in our organization. At Elastic, we effectively don’t have a hierarchy to speak of. We feel that anyone needs to be in the position to comment on absolutely anything, regardless of their role within the company

Right now, we are on the outlook for a passionate and talented geospatial Java Engineer to join our Elasticsearch team. This role can be based (pretty much) anywhere in the world.

These are the kinds of problems you will work on

  • Investigate and implement optimizations for geo spatial indexing and search data structures
  • Integrate new geospatial features from Lucene
  • Implement new geospatial aggregations including spatial statistics, clustering, and hot spot analysis
  • Improve existing geospatial APIs including new intercommunication formats
  • Work closely with cross product teams to expand geospatial offerings at all levels of the Elastic stack.

What you will bring along

  • Experience implementing geospatial data structures (e.g. spatial trees, tries).
  • Familiarity with exploratory spatial data analysis and spatial statistics techniques.
  • A firm understanding of geospatial coordinate systems, map projections, and datum transformations.

Do you know the answers most of these questions?

  • When would you make a variable volatile?
  • How do you decide whether to use a HashMap or a TreeMap?
  • How do you decide whether to use a CopyOnWriteArrayList or a Collections.synchronizedList(ArrayList)?
  • When would you use mergesort over quicksort?
  • When might recursion cause stack overflows?
  • Is Math.abs(Random.nextInt()) always positive?
  • What are the pros/cons of async vs. blocking I/O?
  • What unit tests would you write for Arrays.binarySearch?

Additional Information

  • Competitive pay and benefits.
  • Stock options
  • Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices
  • An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life
  • Passionate people building great products
  • Employees with a wide variety of interests
  • Distributed-first company with employees in over 30 countries, spread across 18 time zones, and speaking over 30 languages! Some even fly south for the winter :)

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

About Elastic

Elastic is the world's leading software provider for making structured and unstructured data usable in real time for search, logging, security, and analytics use cases. Founded in 2012 by the people behind the Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash open source projects, Elastic's global community has more than 80,000 members across 45 countries, and since i ts initial release. Elastic's products have achieved more than 100 million cumulative downloads. Today thousands of organizations, including Cisco, eBay, Dell, Goldman Sachs, Groupon, HP, Microsoft, Netflix, The New York Times, Uber, Verizon, Yelp, and Wikipedia, use the Elastic Stack, X-Pack, and Elastic Cloud to power mission-critical systems that drive new revenue opportunities and massive cost savings. Elastic is backed by more than $104 million in funding from Benchmark Capital, Index Ventures, and NEA; has headquarters in Amsterdam, the Netherlands, and Mountain View, California; and has over 400 employees in more than 30 countries around the world.

Additional Information

  • Competitive pay and benefits
  • Stock options
  • Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices
  • An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life
  • Passionate people building great products
  • Employees with a wide variety of interests
  • Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

items.title: Front-End Software Engineer-100% Remote at Sonatype () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Agile Software Development, Computer Software
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Sonatype’s mission is to enable organizations to better manage their software supply chain.  We offer a series of products and services including the Nexus Repository Manager and Nexus Lifecycle Manager.

We are a remote and talented product development group and we work in small autonomous teams to create high quality products. Thousands of organizations and millions of developers use our software. If you have a passion for challenging problems, software craftsmanship, and having impact, then Sonatype is the right place for you.

Required Experience & Skills

  • Strong software engineering foundation and experience
  • A passion for delightful user experiences.
  • A deep sense of quality and attention to detail.
  • Strong software engineering foundation and experience
  • Well versed in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, relevant frameworks, and toolchain.
  • Experience working in an environment leveraging remote communication and collaboration tools (e.g. HipChat, Slack, video conferencing, wikis, GitHub, etc.).
  • Have a strong bias for making things happen and love the team aspect of product development.
  • Legally authorized to work (without sponsorship) in Canada, the United Kingdom, or the United States of America and are currently residing in the corresponding country.

Desired Experience & Skills

  • Experience with AngularJS and/or Ext JS.
  • Experience with build automation tools and state management libraries.
  • Ability to work across the stack as needed (REST APIs, back-end services, databases).
  • Java development experience; Java drives the backend of our applications.
  • Experience in an Agile development environment.
  • Experience working in a remote environment.

About Sonatype

We are Sonatype, and we have assembled a world class team of employees, investors, and partners. We are proud to be recognized as a Deloitte Technology Fast 500 company for 2016. With more than 120,000 installations and counting, Nexus products are helping modern development organizations intelligently source, manage, assemble, and maintain open source and third-party components, so they can improve the quality, security, and speed of their software supply chains.

We are curious and constantly innovating without fear of failure. We are attacking a huge and emerging market and seeking remarkably talented individuals to join us on our journey.

Sonatype is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer that is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Benefits

CareFirst BCBS
401k, HSA, FSA
100% Telecommute
15 days of PTO and 12 Company Holidays
No BS and No Jerks
Agile Development
Flex Scheduling
Mac, Linux, or Window machine - your choice
Small, high-performing team structure

items.title: Senior Java Developer needed for a hyper-scale DLT / Blockchain company at Radix DLT (Stoke-on-Trent, UK) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Banking, blockchain, Financial Technology
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

In R&D for 6 years, Radix is moving into launch mode for a completely new trustless Distributed Ledger Technology platform, designed from the ground up for speed and scalability.

Your role will be central to the further development and optimisation of the Radix Core. You will work side by side with the CTO and founder, Dan Hughes, refining the Radix DLT, stress testing, and ensuring all elements of Radix are as efficient and bug free as possible.

This is right on the cutting edge of crypto, distributed computing, and crypto-economics. It will included the moving of a large code base from a development to a production environment. Experience in security testing and commercial deployment of distributed systems is highly beneficial, as well as a sincere love of problem solving.

You should be an excellent Enterprise Java developer and problem solver, with a strong grounding in mathematics. Prior experience with cryptography and blockchain/DLT a plus.

For a very basic introduction to the Radix platform, here is a quick 2 minute video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XLve0N-I63E

For a bit more of an in depth video, here is Radix CEO, Piers, speaking at a recent crypto conference in Amsterdam:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lVSl5J3-TNQ

And to dive into the tech, here is the Radix consensus white paper: 

https://daks2k3a4ib2z.cloudfront.net/59b6f7652473ae000158679b/…

About Radix DLT

THE RADIX MODEL

We are looking for exceptional, self motivated and passionate team members. 

We don't care if you have a masters degree, a PhD or never went to college. All we care about is whether you are world class at what you do.

WORKING AT RADIX

We believe strongly in both the importance of team bonding and benefits of flexible/remote working. For Radix, this means an initial period where you MUST be located with our CTO, Dan, in Stoke, England for a minimum of 3 months. After this period, you may locate anywhere in the world you wish to be.

COMFORT WITH UNCERTAINTY

This is a very fast moving area of technology, with much of the path yet untrodden. You need to be very comfortable with generating hypotheses, testing these hypotheses and quickly using your learning and mistakes to iterate towards solutions. We don't have all the answers, but together we can find them.

Benefits

Remote Working
Competitive Salary

items.title: Backend Engineer - Waldo Photos - Remote
items.content:
Backend Engineer
Waldo Photos -Remote
$80,000 - $100,000 a year
Waldo Photos is a photo-finding platform empowering people to toss their selfie sticks, put their phones back in their pockets, and live in the moment. Waldo is the only platform that removes all of the friction in getting photos of you taken by others and creates new opportunities for photographers to market and sell their photos. Our users can enjoy life’s most precious events and automatically receive images taken of them right on their phones, or share images of others they’ve taken without having to lift a finger – whether between friends and family or a professional photographer.
We're looking for an independent problem-solver who values learning, keeps current on technology trends, and enjoys the ownership and accountability that is expected from early-stage team members. The ideal candidate will:
  • enjoy coding at all layers, focusing mainly in the backend;
  • learn whatever is necessary to get the job done;
  • write clean, elegant, simple, testable code;
  • be comfortable with git, pull requests, and code reviews;
  • take pride in their work; and
  • want to work with others who do the same.
While we're based in Austin, Texas, we have team members all across the globe. We are open to remote, international, contract employees – but we do need full-time commitment.

Requirements:
BASE QUALIFICATIONS

  • You've been actively coding in Python or Java for at least 5 years.
  • You have excellent algorithmic and coding skills.
  • You feel comfortable in learning and eventually using each of these, as we're developing our services in them: Python, Java, Javascript, Clojure, and Go.
  • You know how to efficiently and properly design relational databases with a deep understanding of what affects query performance.
  • You know what the conceptual difference is between PostgreSQL, Cassandra or Kafka, and RabbitMQ – which by the way, we use all of these and more!
  • "I always write tests for my code" is your middle name.
  • You thrive in a small team, high autonomy environment.
DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • You have a proven track record of building and shipping complex, high-performance, highly-available distributed systems.
  • You have an experience with GraphQL and related libraries (i.e. Apollo, Relay).
  • You love leading and mentoring a team.
Benefits:
  • Ability to work remote from anywhere in the world
  • East Austin office that is dog-friendly
  • Flexible vacation
  • Unlimited high fives (both virtual and in-person)
DETAILS
  • Type: Full-time
  • Location: Austin or remote
  • Annual salary: $80,000 - $100,000
  • Equity: 0.0% - 0.20%

items.title: Backend Engineer - Waldo Photos - Remote
items.content:
Backend Engineer
Waldo Photos -Remote
$80,000 - $100,000 a year
Waldo Photos is a photo-finding platform empowering people to toss their selfie sticks, put their phones back in their pockets, and live in the moment. Waldo is the only platform that removes all of the friction in getting photos of you taken by others and creates new opportunities for photographers to market and sell their photos. Our users can enjoy life’s most precious events and automatically receive images taken of them right on their phones, or share images of others they’ve taken without having to lift a finger – whether between friends and family or a professional photographer.

items.title: VET360 - Auto-Tester Developer #1 - CSRA - Remote
items.content:
VET360 - Auto-Tester Developer #1
CSRA -Remote
Full-time, Other
Clearance Level Must Currently Possess:

No Active Clearance Required

Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain:

No Active Clearance Required

Suitability:

Public Trust

Job Family:

Engineering & Sciences

Job Description:

Essential Functions and Job Responsibilities

The successful candidate will work with cross-functional team of users and customers to document product requirements that support a master data management solution, and to identify business processes and requirements for integrating a master data record solution across a large enterprise. However, this is a highly technical position that requires knowledge of frameworks, source code libraries, middleware services, and REST calls.

Duties and responsibilities, in order of relevance, to include, but are not limited to:
  • Document the technical requirements through by reviewing and documenting Gherkin feature files and reviewing Java source code libraries
  • Identify technical integration requirements by data domain to support elementary and cross-functional considerations / product extensions
  • Convert requirements into structured requirements language using Gherkin
  • Present technical requirements to broad group of stakeholders and incorporate feedback
  • Work with software developers to implement technical requirements to extend product framework
  • Ability to analyze customer data for consistency and quality
  • Define data exception processing and automated / manual paths for resolution
  • Partner with Agile Release Train to plan for new functionality, resolve defects, and incorporate error injection test methodologies
  • Participate in Agile software development practices to decompose tasks and accelerate delivery
  • Support the definition of epics, user stories and tasks for new features to a fully-groomed status prior to acceptance into a Program Increment and/or development Sprint;
  • Prepare documentation to support software delivery of automated functionality
Minimum Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, or a related scientific or technical discipline
  • At least 5 years of experience overseeing analysis of business, functional, technical, activities, and events to drive business process improvements
  • Experience working as a technical system analyst on more generic frameworks and/or libraries and/or products

# of Openings:

1

Scheduled Weekly Hours:

40

Telecommuting Options:

Telecommuting 100%

Work Location:

USA MD Home Office (MDHOME)

Additional Work Locations:

CSRA is committed to creating a diverse environment and is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

items.title: CompilerWorks | San Francisco Bay Area | Full-time, remote | $100k-$220k driven by your productivity. We are currently a team of 7 across 3 continents.
items.content:
CompilerWorks | San Francisco Bay Area | Full-time, remote | $100k-$220k driven by your productivity. We are currently a team of 7 across 3 continents.

http://www.compilerworks.com/job.html (experienced Java devs only)

CompilerWorks is a bespoke compiler company, with our core product centered around compiling on dialect of SQL to execute on a different backend - e.g. would you like to run Oracle PL/SQL on a Postgre database? You can with CompilerWorks. With this core capability our compilers are being deployed to do a lot more than simply transpile code.

We are driven to solve interesting engineering problems where compilers are useful. We have found many interesting applications in the world of databases/datawarehouses and "big data."

Let us know if you are interested info {at} compilerworks.com

items.title: PhishMe: Sr. Production Engineer
items.content:
Sr. Production Engineer

Posted Dec 1

PhishMe
Headquarters: Leesburg, VA

PhishMe is seeking an experienced Production Engineer to architect, automate, provision, monitor, and maintain administrative and production Linux-based infrastructure.

 
The successful candidate must have professional work experience. This is a full-time position working for PhishMe, Inc. We actively encourage diversity on our team and overall company.

Responsibilities: 

  • Work closely with Engineering and Product teams to identify and implement solutions that meet production, QA, development, and administrative needs in Linux-based environments
  • Identify changes for the product architecture from the reliability, performance, and availability perspective with a data driven approach.
  • Interface with on-site system administrators
  • Architect and maintain multi-site, high-availability solutions
  • Own and suggest improvements to our deployment process and tools
  • Identify technical debt and provide plans to remediate.
  • Determine when code needs to be refactored without making it obscure.
  • Diagnose and resolve production system issues
  • Participate in rotating on-call schedule
  • Other duties as assigned
The above statements are neither intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job described, nor are they intended to be a listing of all of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Rather, they are intended only to describe the general nature of the job. This job description is not a contract of employment, either express or implied. Employment with PhishMe will be voluntarily entered into and your employment is considered at will. PhishMe reserves the right to alter the job description at any time without notice.
Successful applicants must be:

  • A self-starter who is willing to take a task from gathering requirements to deployment and maintenance
  • Able to work effectively and be pragmatic as part of a remote team in a dynamic business environment
  • Know a domain really well and able to share that knowledge
  • Comfortable working independently and able to escalate problems when necessary
  • Able to take charge of a nebulous requirement and drive it through design to completion
  • Can identify problem or opportunity areas, develop and implement fixes and changes as necessary
  • Able to communicate effectively with developers, engineers and upper management
  • Eager to learn; able to understand and apply new things relatively quickly
  • Willing to mentor and guide fellow team members effectively and constructively in a wide variety of disciplines, both technical and business-like in nature
  • Happy to travel occasionally for team meetings and events
 

Your experience should demonstrate that you:

  • Have experience with Ubuntu and Red Hat/CentOS in production environments
  • Have acted in a leadership capacity (led teams) to provide services/functions in a production setting
  • Have championed new technologies/processes, and architected their design, implementation and delivery to production
  • Are proficient with configuration management tools (Ansible preferred)
  • Have experience supporting full stack Java applications(Maven/Artifactory)
  • Have experience using and supporting CI environments (Jenkins/Docker)
  • Can manage and support cloud (AWS) production environments
  • Familiar with managing and maintaining Route53 configurations
  • Can implement and manage high-availabiity infrastructure solutions with automatic failover
  • Managed PostgreSQL, Hazelcast, and Elastic Search in production environments
  • Are able to coordinate large feature development
  • Polyglot (multi-lingual) programming expertise
  • Ready to lead or has lead small teams
  • Stay on top of current DevOps and infrastructure news
  • Have used docker in a production environment as part of the "product", not just in the CI workflow.
  • Have experience with docker orchestration - eg. Kubernetes, Rancher etc.
It would really be outstanding if you:

  • Have used docker in a remote environment (think appliance)
 

Compensation:

  • Competitive salary and stock options
  • 401k plan with company match
  • Health, vision, dental, disability, and life insurance
  • Telecom expense reimbursement

Location:

  • US Telecommute
 

PhishMe is committed to equal employment opportunity. We will not discriminate against employees or applicants for employment on any legally recognized basis [protected class] including, but not limited to: veteran status, uniform service member status, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or any other protected class under federal, state, or local law.

Apply for this position

To apply for this position please follow the link below:https://careers-phishme.icims.com/jobs/1384/sr.-production-engineer/job

items.title: Visual/UI Designer
items.content:
About Us:


We are 2amigos Consulting Group, a team of solution creators and builders with a core belief in delivering excellence. Our drive for "getting it" ensures that we become emotionally invested in our client’s business and each of their projects. This value breeds a company culture of providing products and solutions that delight our customers every time. The results are always something we and our clients can take pride in.

Please read Our 12 Points Of Culture.

The right designer for this position is an extremely driven and self-motivated artisan. You will be a self-starter that takes ownership in your work and believes in excellence.

As you report to our Head of Design, you will be responsible for working closely with clients and members of your team to come up with original and relevant designs from discussions and half-formed ideas. You'll work across our broad range of projects, both internal and customer facing, while also working on prototyping new products.

Due to the speed at which we're moving, you must be able to hit the ground running from Day One. Yes, we have a company onboarding process, and we’re growing quickly. Therefore, we expect 3+ years of industry experience or equivalent work history.

This is a remote position that can be performed anywhere.


Responsibilities:


  • Collaborate with our design leadership to deliver designs across our client portfolio and internal products
  • Collaborate with developers to balance trade-offs in velocity, complexity, and simplicity
  • Ensure quality of design in development, managing output of specs, assets & styles to developers
  • Take creative direction and work efficiently and independently
  • Communicate designs and articulate the "why" of those design decisions through sketches, wireframes, mockups, interactive prototypes
  • Evaluate design problems and present designs to clients on regular video meetings, and via email
  • Help iterate and contribute to our design process and team culture not only as we scale as a team, but also as a company


    Requirements:


  • A team player and a positive addition to our company culture (Our 12 Points Of Culture)
  • Motivated and organized, dedicated and accountable
  • Independent thinker and executer who needs little oversight, can work both autonomously and as part of a team
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and an enthusiasm for teamwork
  • You take pride and ownership of every detail, every step of the way
  • Strong portfolio demonstrating a passion for design and knowledge about interaction models, customer flows, style guides, user interface, and prototypes, information architecture, hierarchy, and layout
  • Experience designing for multiple device types and contexts
  • Experience designing across platforms (web, desktop, and mobile), including a habit of staying well-versed on platform design specs, standards, and patterns

    Tools we use:


  • Pen and paper
  • Sketch
  • Photoshop
  • Zeplin
  • Invision
  • Principle, Framer, or other (not required)

    Bonus:


  • Experience with UX design principles
  • Experience with animations and/or video

    We Offer:


  • Full-time and remote work
  • Competitive salary
  • A rapidly growing company environment
  • Access to training and people that can mentor

items.title: Senior Java Developer - FIS - Milwaukee, WI
items.content:
Senior Java Developer
FIS -Milwaukee, WI 53223
FIS connects banks to consumers and consumers to their money through leading-edge payments solutions. We’re the development engine of FIS — the largest, Fortune 500, global Fintech company — processing 27 billion financial transactions across the planet every year. Our solution is branded by our customers — banks and retailers — so you might not have heard of us. But, if you’ve used a debit card to complete a financial transaction, you’re most likely using FIS Payments software. Our product is one that touches the average consumer on a regular basis, and makes the financial world go ‘round.

Our team is fast paced and fun. We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving. We are passionate about our product, and we strive to delight for our customers. We have high expectations given the Financial responsibility for accuracy and security to the world. We process an average of 60K transactions per day and move $2B per night. A career in our team means challenging yourself to always be better.

Position Description:

FIS is looking for an energetic individual who will strive to meet the needs of our growing business. This individual will play a key role in analysis, design, development and implementation of Payment applications. This individual will work closely with other internal/external departments to ensure that the solution is meeting the needs of the business. Additionally, this individual will be responsible for night call support and problem resolution.

Responsibilities:
  • Drive the design, development and implementation of technology solutions
  • Work with project team in an Agile development approach to understand requirements, elicit feedback and refine solution through demonstrations
  • Participate in the entire SDLC and interface with Product Managers, clients, other IT partner and vendors in delivering solutions and troubleshooting technical issues during integration, migration of software components
  • Ensure designs are compliant with FIS Policies

    Required Skills:
  • Degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science or equivalent experience
  • 5+ years of experience in Java, Soap Web Services and Spring Framework
  • Database experience in SQL Server
  • Tool experience in Eclipse, or a similar tool
  • Experience with Agile Development methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, SAFe, etc.)
  • Strong communication skills
  • Detail-oriented, with excellent analytical and problem resolution skills
  • Passion for continuous improvement
  • Motivated to write quality, testable and readable code
  • Ability to thrive in a fast paced and dynamic environment
  • Experience in payments or high transactional systems
  • Additional experience in working with remote team members a plus

Preferred Skills:
  • Experience with JavaScript, JSP, CSS, AJAX, JQuery, UNIX, HTML, XML,
  • Experience with JSON, MQ Series, UML, AngularJS
  • Experience in Securing Coding to prevent XSS, CSRF and other vulnterabiliteis
  • Experience in SunOne and WebSphere
  • Other database experience such as Oracle and DB2
  • Familiarity with the Atlassian tool suite including JIRA, Confluence and GIT

Advanced professional role. Highly-skilled with extensive proficiency. Develops large and/or complex solutions that require analysis and research. Works on multiple projects as a project leader or frequently as the subject matter expert. Works on projects/issues of medium to high complexity that require demonstrated knowledge across multiple technical areas and business segments. Coaches and mentors junior technical staff. Works under minimal supervision on complex projects. Wide latitude for independent judgment. Typically requires six or more years’ demonstrated applications development experience with at least one project as the application development technical lead on a “large” project, i.e., a project with duration of more than 6,000 hours or spanning more than four months.

**Current and future Visa sponsorship not available for this position**

FIS™ is the world's largest global provider dedicated to financial technology solutions. FIS empowers the financial world with software, services, consulting and outsourcing solutions focused on retail and institutional banking, payments, asset and wealth management, risk and compliance, trade enablement, transaction processing and record-keeping. FIS’ more than 53,000 worldwide employees are passionate about moving our clients’ business forward. Headquartered in Jacksonville, Florida, FIS serves more than 20,000 clients in over 130 countries, and our technology powers billions of transactions annually that move over $9 trillion around the globe. FIS is a Fortune 500 company and is a member of Standard & Poor’s 500® Index.

.

FIS is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster is available here: www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf and here: www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf

For positions located in the US, the conditions below apply. If you are made a conditional offer of employment, you will be required to undergo a drug test and background check (including criminal record check) ADA Disclaimer: In developing this job description care was taken to include all competencies needed to successfully perform in this position. However, for Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) purposes, the essential functions of the job may or may not have been described for purposes of ADA reasonable accommodation. All reasonable accommodation requests will be reviewed and evaluated on a case-by-case basis.

As part of the selection process this role may require an assessment to determine suitability

Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

We are passionate about our product, and we strive to delight for our customers. We have high expectations given the Financial responsibility for accuracy and security to the world. We process an average of 60K transactions per day and move $2B per night. A career in our team means challenging yourself to always be better.

Position Description:

FIS is looking for an energetic individual who will strive to meet the needs of our growing business. This individual will play a key role in analysis, design, development and implementation of Payment applications. This individual will work closely with other internal/external departments to ensure that the solution is meeting the needs of the business. Additionally, this individual will be responsible for night call support and problem resolution.

Responsibilities:
  • Drive the design, development and implementation of technology solutions
  • Work with project team in an Agile development approach to understand requirements, elicit feedback and refine solution through demonstrations
  • Participate in the entire SDLC and interface with Product Managers, clients, other IT partner and vendors in delivering solutions and troubleshooting technical issues during integration, migration of software components
  • Ensure designs are compliant with FIS Policies

    Required Skills:
  • Degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science or equivalent experience
  • 5+ years of experience in Java, Soap Web Services and Spring Framework
  • Database experience in SQL Server
  • Tool experience in Eclipse, or a similar tool
  • Experience with Agile Development methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, SAFe, etc.)
  • Strong communication skills
  • Detail-oriented, with excellent analytical and problem resolution skills
  • Passion for continuous improvement
  • Motivated to write quality, testable and readable code
  • Ability to thrive in a fast paced and dynamic environment
  • Experience in payments or high transactional systems
  • Additional experience in working with remote team members a plus

Preferred Skills:
  • Experience with JavaScript, JSP, CSS, AJAX, JQuery, UNIX, HTML, XML,
  • Experience with JSON, MQ Series, UML, AngularJS
  • Experience in Securing Coding to prevent XSS, CSRF and other vulnterabiliteis
  • Experience in SunOne and WebSphere
  • Other database experience such as Oracle and DB2
  • Familiarity with the Atlassian tool suite including JIRA, Confluence and GIT

Advanced professional role. Highly-skilled with extensive proficiency. Develops large and/or complex solutions that require analysis and research. Works on multiple projects as a project leader or frequently as the subject matter expert. Works on projects/issues of medium to high complexity that require demonstrated knowledge across multiple technical areas and business segments. Coaches and mentors junior technical staff. Works under minimal supervision on complex projects. Wide latitude for independent judgment. Typically requires six or more years’ demonstrated applications development experience with at least one project as the application development technical lead on a “large” project, i.e., a project with duration of more than 6,000 hours or spanning more than four months.

**Current and future Visa sponsorship not available for this position**

FIS™ is the world's largest global provider dedicated to financial technology solutions. FIS empowers the financial world with software, services, consulting and outsourcing solutions focused on retail and institutional banking, payments, asset and wealth management, risk and compliance, trade enablement, transaction processing and record-keeping. FIS’ more than 53,000 worldwide employees are passionate about moving our clients’ business forward. Headquartered in Jacksonville, Florida, FIS serves more than 20,000 clients in over 130 countries, and our technology powers billions of transactions annually that move over $9 trillion around the globe. FIS is a Fortune 500 company and is a member of Standard & Poor’s 500® Index.

.

FIS is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster is available here: www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf and here: www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf

For positions located in the US, the conditions below apply. If you are made a conditional offer of employment, you will be required to undergo a drug test and background check (including criminal record check) ADA Disclaimer: In developing this job description care was taken to include all competencies needed to successfully perform in this position. However, for Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) purposes, the essential functions of the job may or may not have been described for purposes of ADA reasonable accommodation. All reasonable accommodation requests will be reviewed and evaluated on a case-by-case basis.

As part of the selection process this role may require an assessment to determine suitability

Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

items.title: Nugg: Graphic designer for cannabis tech startup
items.content:
Graphic designer for cannabis tech startup

Posted Nov 28

Nugg
Headquarters: LA
www.getnugg.com

Nugg (getnugg.com) is one of the hottest startups in the $30-50 billion cannabis space. If you are passionate about joining a dynamic company that is already an industry leader (with massive growth potential), Nugg is the right place for you.

WHAT YOU’LL BE CHARGED WITH:

We are looking for a graphic designer and marketing specialist who can support a creative, high-volume content strategy by producing visually compelling art, images, illustrations, and interactive media. You should be comfortable editing photos, creating original vector-based illustrations, and implementing brand standards to maintain a consistent aesthetic across multiple digital formats. You should understand basic content marketing concepts and be comfortable providing art direction to fulfill strategic and tactical deliverables.

HOURS & LOCATION:

This is a full-time (40 hours/week) position that can be completed 100% remotely, but if you’re in the Los Angeles area, you’re welcome to work out of our Marina Del Rey office. This is an independent contractor position, with the potential to shift into a full-time role based on performance.

COMPENSATION:  

$40-60 an hour, depending on experience

RESPONSIBILITIES:

—Collaborate with writers, editors, and other producers to develop a compelling digital marketing strategy.

— Assist in developing creative concepts for editorial and social media calendars and provide individual graphic support for each platform, as needed.

—To use clever and innovative graphics to support a variety of content such as commercial intent, data-driven, thought leadership, community engagement, and others.

—Identify new ways to use graphic design to reach and engage new and existing customers.

—Implement best practices for image optimization, meta data, and digital file management.

—Natural self-starter and resourceful in nature. Strong project management skills and ability to foresee obstacles within deadlines and communicate effectively to key stakeholders.

ESSENTIAL SKILLS:

—Proven expertise in Adobe Creative Suite and Sketch for designing and editing photos, illustrations, and other graphics.

—Experience creating original vector-based designs.

—Ability to adhere to brand standards and style guidelines.

—Web-savvy with a true passion for digital art, design, and user experience.

—A solid understanding of digital marketing, and content marketing in particular.

—Self-starter, highly motivated to succeed under minimal supervision.

—Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript a plus.

—Experience and/or passion for cannabis preferred.

COMPANY OVERVIEW:

Based in Los Angeles, we’re the nation’s largest online cannabis marketplace. We provide quick, easy, and professional access to medical marijuana delivery for people in California, and have ambitious plans to offer our services throughout the entire United States.

The other arm of our business, NuggMD, is the nation’s leading telemedicine platform for cannabis, connecting potential cannabis users with licensed doctors via live video to make getting a doctor’s recommendation for medical cannabis quick and painless.

NuggMD is the leading telemedicine platform for cannabis evaluations, has served over 100,000 people in California and New York, and will be available in more states soon.

BENEFITS & CULTURE:

We’re a half-remote, half Los Angeles local team, and that’s just the way we like it. At Nugg, you can work whenever, wherever, however, as long as you get your shit done. We’re a laid-back team that enjoys ping pong, Saturday brunch, the outdoors, house music, and the little things in life.

As our newest team member, you’ll be given full autonomy to execute on your ideas. You’ll get as many vacation days as you want, and we’ll even vacation together (Colombia next spring, yo!) At Nugg, you’ll have boatloads of fun, while testing the limits of your expertise and innovative capacities. At Nugg, life gets a little better each day.

Apply for this position

Apply at https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1teLLd8Z5EMxYs2DXDGlBDjaW3-8mBmc4p6lIDysR0gs

items.title: Senior Software Engineer @ Parse.ly
items.content:
Senior Software Engineer @ Parse.ly

2017-11-24 17:44

Description

Do you enjoy distributed systems, large-scale data analysis, and modern open source stacks? Do you also enjoy engineering management books, and believe in the value of engineering apprenticeship, which can allow junior engineers to level up in their career? If so, you might enjoy being a Senior Software Engineer at Parse.ly.

First, let’s answer a key question: what’s Parse.ly? Well, Parse.ly is a real-time content measurement layer for the entire web. Our analytics platform helps digital storytellers at some of the web's best sites, such as Arstechnica, The New Yorker, The Wall Street Journal, TechCrunch, The Intercept, Mashable, and many more. In total, our analytics system handles over 65 billion monthly events from over 1 billion monthly unique visitors.

Our entire stack is in Python and JavaScript, and our team has innovated in areas related to real-time analytics, building some of the best open source tools for working with modern stream processing technologies.

On the open source front, we maintain streamparse, the most widely used Python binding for the Apache Storm streaming data system. We also maintain pykafka, the most performant and Pythonic binding for Apache Kafka.

Our colleagues are talented: our UX/design team has also built one of the best-looking dashboards on the planet, using AngularJS and D3.js, and our infrastructure engineers have built a scalable devops-friendly cloud environment.

As a Senior Software Engineer, you would master our backend stack -- or, fill in whatever gaps you might be missing if you already know some of our technologies. But you’d also spend a portion of your time defining a roadmap for our “Customer Success Engineering” group, which is a group of bright engineers, more junior in their career, who are focusing on customer-facing and customer-deployed data integration challenges. It’s an ideal opportunity to put your programming skills to use, while also flexing some engineering and project management skills, to boot.

Responsibilities

Parse.ly’s data engineering team already makes use of modern technologies like Python, Storm, Spark, Kafka, and Elasticsearch to analyze large datasets. As a Software Engineer at Parse.ly, you will be expected to master these technologies, while also being able to write code against them in Python, and debug issues down to the native C code and native JVM code layers, as necessary.

However, your focus will be on deep understanding, commensurate with your technical background. Our product is widely used by over 250 enterprises with over 30,000 active seats, each of whom is viewing our data on a regular basis, and we have a team of engineers who help assist these customers with understanding their data, debugging data integration problems, and investigating code and data discrepancies. You would lead this team with its own focused roadmap of how to apply programming skills to solve customer problems.

Examples of past projects this team has built:

  • A page data debugging tool, using web crawling
  • An automated system for re-processing customer data to correct historical errors
  • A public API explorer tool, for understanding how to use our HTTP/JSON API
  • An admin panel for tracking customer usage, pricing tiers, and invites
  • An Amazon Redshift based data warehouse for doing product usage analytics

If you get excited by the idea of specifying and clarifying requirements around “quick-win” engineering projects that have a huge impact on the business and on how our customers interact with our support team, this is an ideal role for you.

What you'll do

For this role, you should already be a proficient programmer who wants to work with data at scale. You should already have, or be willing to gain, a full level of Python expertise.

In the role, you’ll...

  • Write Python code using the best practices. See The Elements of Python Style, written by our CTO, for an example of our approach to code readability and design.
  • Analyze data at massive scale. You need to be comfortable with the idea of your code running across 3,000 Python cores, thanks to process-level parallelization.
  • Brainstorm new ideas for how automation can solve problems for our customer success team. You need to be a good communicator, especially in written form.
  • Own a product roadmap for "Customer Success Engineering", with a team of at least 5 junior engineers who would execute that roadmap.
  • Directly mentor these 5 engineers as they gain new skills in programming, web development, and data analysis.
  • Master cloud technologies and systems. You should love UNIX and be able to reason about distributed systems.

Benefits

Our distributed team is best-in-class and we happily skip commutes by working out of our ergonomic home offices. Here's a photograph of our CTO's setup running two full-screen Parse.ly dashboards.

  • Work from home or anywhere else in our industry-leading distributed team.
  • Earn a competitive salary and benefits (health/dental/401k).
  • Splurge with a generous equipment budget.
  • Work with one of the brightest teams in tech.
  • Speak at and attend conferences like PyData on Parse.ly's dime.

Parse.ly Tech

  • Python for both backend and frontend -- 2.7, some systems in 3.x, and we're going full-on 3.x soon.
  • Amazon Web Services used for most systems.
  • Modern databases like Cassandra, ElasticSearch, Redis, and Postgres.
  • Frameworks like Django, Tornado and the PyData stack (e.g. Pandas).
  • Running Kafka, Storm, Spark in production atop massive data sets.
  • Easy system management with Fabric and Chef.

Fully distributed team

Parse.ly is a fully distributed team, with engineers working from across the world. People with past experience working remotely will be prioritized. US/Eastern timezones will be prioritized.

Country

United States

Location

EST or CST (or nearby)

items.title: Techops Engineer @ Swiftype
items.content:
Techops Engineer @ Swiftype

2017-11-23 20:38

Description

At Swiftype reliability and speed are key components of our product, and we place tremendous importance on providing a service that exceeds our customers' expectations in those respects. Consequently, we've invested heavily in our operations and infrastructure systems, and we're looking for Technical Operations Engineers to help us continue improving and evolving our systems as we scale.

Sample Projects

  • Implement monitoring for Swiftype infrastructure: from hardware, to operating systems health, to software usage and business metrics.
  • Work on automating all aspects of technical operations work in the company: from hardware provisioning, to software and Swiftype projects deployment.
  • Develop internal tools to help improve development team performance and streamline deployment process.
  • Continuously work on improving Swiftype software performance and infrastructure reliability.

Required Skills (non-negotiable)

Excellent practical judgement. You should know how to effectively allocate your time when solving hard problems.

Qualifications (the more the better)

  • Good knowledge and understanding of Unix systems, solid Linux/UNIX systems administrator experience.
  • Good knowledge and understanding of server hardware (RAID levels, computer architecture, etc).
  • Solid scripting skills (ruby, perl, python, shell).
  • Experience deploying Ruby and Rails applications in production.
  • Experience deploying Java applications in production.
  • Experience deploying, managing and tuning MySQL servers.
  • Experience with open-source monitoring tools like Nagios, Cacti, Ganglia, Graphite, StatsD.
  • Familiarity with Chef, Puppet or similar tools.
  • Familiarity with Hadoop Ecosystem (Zookeeper, Hive, HBase).
  • Experience with open source search software, especially Lucene/Elasticsearch/Solr.

If this sounds interesting, we would love to hear from you. Please include whatever info you believe is relevant: resume, GitHub profile, code samples, links to personal projects, etc.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Data Infrastructure Engineer- Cassandra @ SurveyMonkey
items.content:
Data Infrastructure Engineer- Cassandra @ SurveyMonkey

2017-11-23 20:05

Description

About SurveyMonkey

Founded in 1999 and based in San Mateo, California, SurveyMonkey is the world’s leading platform for turning people’s voices and opinions into actionable data — People Powered Data. Whether it’s with customers, employees, or a target market, SurveyMonkey helps curious individuals and companies — including 99% of the Fortune 500 — have conversations at scale with the people who matter most. It’s People Powered Data that allows them to understand not only “what” is happening, but “why.” SurveyMonkey’s 700+ employees throughout North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific are dedicated to powering the curious.

The Role

In this role, you will work as a member of the data infrastructure team, focusing on open-source databases (Cassandra primarily). You will work with the rest of the team to maintain our open-source data infrastructure, write automation, advise engineers on best practices, and participate in the on-call rotation. You will lead major database-related initiatives and cross-train. You will work closely with other members of the data infrastructure team, developers, product managers, and other stakeholders on projects from idea to implementation.

Responsibilities

  • Maintain, configure, tune, and monitor our database infrastructure
  • Understand and troubleshoot issues across the stack (hardware, software, and network)
  • Document administration and response procedures through runbooks & playbooks
  • Help design and build automation & tooling around all facets of database operation
  • Train and mentor other data infrastructure engineers
  • Participate in the on-call rotation
  • Partner with engineering teams to improve data infrastructure usage and to follow best practices

Qualifications

  • Strong experience managing open-source databases (Cassandra, MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, or other)
  • Strong experience with Linux systems administration
  • You have experience writing Python or other scripting language
  • You have experience with configuration management systems (Ansible is a plus)
  • Excellent communication skills and a proven record of partnering with other engineers
  • Experience with JVM tuning is a plus
  • Experience with Kafka and Zookeeper is a plus

For the right candidate, the team will consider someone who is remote.

At SurveyMonkey, we offer competitive salaries, medical/dental benefits, PTO, 401k, paid holidays, and equity compensation.SurveyMonkey is an equal opportunity employer.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: CircleCI : Senior Support Engineer - APAC Region
items.content:
Senior Support Engineer - APAC Region

Posted Nov 21

CircleCI
Headquarters: San Francisco, CA
https://jobs.lever.co/circleci/8138d8b4-678e-4ce0-8121-2827813cdf53?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=WEWORKREMOTELY

YOUR IMPACT

As a Senior Support Engineer at CircleCI you will have an impact every day by working directly with our customers to help them get the best from the CircleCI platform. You’ll be working directly with developers (both customers and CircleCI engineers) to help shape and improve the the product and customer experience.

ABOUT THE ROLE
This is a full-time, remote position. You’re someone who thrives working remotely without much (if any) oversight. You’ll be part of the Support Team which is currently ten people. We’re a fully remote team with employees around world. You’ll be a product expert in all areas. You’ll spend most of your days sending timely, human replies to questions via support tickets, but you’ll also craft documentation, troubleshoot potential bugs, and collaborate with the rest of the team to be as helpful as possible to our customers.

As a Senior Support Engineer you’ll focus on technical ‘deep-dives’ to get to the bottom of problems and create solutions. We’d rather you spent a day solving a tricky problem for an important customer than running through 30 easy tickets. You’ll be creating scripts, configuration enhancements and automating processes for customers and our internal tooling. Writing bug reports and escalations for the product and engineering teams is an important part of the role, we expect you to always act in the best interest of the customer.
You’ll be given plenty of autonomy to simply do what’s right, no questions asked.

With great power comes great responsibility.
As someone on the front line, your understanding of the product and our customers is incredibly valuable. You’ll be able to share knowledge with the product team to make sure we’re getting it right.
We believe that sustainable growth for CircleCI is a byproduct of putting our customers and their needs, first. You’ll be actively collaborating with the customer success, customer engineering and product teams to help our customers.

About CircleCI
Velocity is critical for software teams in today's competitive landscape, but maintaining speed can be difficult as apps and systems grow larger and more complex. CircleCI’s platform allows developers to rapidly release code (for web and mobile apps) they trust by automating the build, test, and deploy process. CircleCI enables developers to detect and fix bugs before they even reach customers. Thousands of leading companies including Facebook, Kickstarter, Shyp and Spotify rely on CircleCI to accelerate delivery of their code and enable developers to focus on creating business value fast.

CircleCI is a Bay Area Best Places to Work 2016 award winner. Founded in 2011 and headquartered in beautiful downtown San Francisco with a global remote workforce, CircleCI is venture backed by Scale Venture Partners, DFJ, Baseline Ventures and Harrison Metal Capital.
CircleCI has a remote team with employees around the world and in our San Francisco and Toronto offices.

For details about our technology stack please see this StackShare post by our CTO: https://stackshare.io/circleci/how-circleci-processes-4-5-million-builds-per-month

Requirements:
  • We’re looking for someone who can work hours that overlap with Asia Pacific time zones.
  • Because we value work-life balance and creating a sustainable position, we prefer if you are geographically located in an equivalent timezone to UTC +13 to UTC +8 (so you do not need to zone-shift or work far outside of normal business hours where you live).
  • This job is Monday-Friday, full-time in your timezone (hours are flexible but we prefer it if you can keep a regular pattern)

Are you empathetic to developers and love to problem-solve? We’d love to talk to you if:

  • You are self-sufficient and love the challenge of solving problems and learning new things.
  • You welcome an environment where you can do great work independently.
  • You’re patient and resilient, with an excellent sense of humor.
  • You’re an exceptional listener and educator, and you’re naturally curious with a strong desire to learn.
  • You’re an effective communicator, fluent in written English.
  • Your writing is clear and simple. You’re confident with humility and empathy.
  • You have determination and take initiative and ownership to see things through to completion. If it needs doing, you do it.
  • You aren’t scared of a challenge. When you don’t know something, you embrace the chance to grow and get better.
  • You have strong Linux / Unix based operating system knowledge. Bash and shell scripting skills are invaluable.
  • You have experience with a range of web and application development stacks and ecosystems, such as Ruby, Python, PHP, JavaScript, Java, iOS and Android.
  • You’re familiar with the ecosystems around these stacks (their frameworks, dependency management tools and deployment options).
  • You’re familiar with relational and non-relational databases and their configuration options.
  • You’re experienced with Git and Github / Bitbucket.
  • You’ve worked with Docker and container based technologies.
  • You’re comfortable searching and reading log files to locate the source of problems.
  • Have some knowledge of Unit Testing and Test Driven Development.
  • Have some knowledge of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery methodologies.

Apply for this position

If you’re interested in joining the team, please follow the link above to send us your resume and a cover letter explaining why you’d be a great fit. If you have an easily accessible presence on the web (Twitter, blog, Github, LinkedIn, etc.) please share it.We care deeply about diversity and inclusivity. We’re hiring at all experience levels, and seek talented teammates from a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences who are equally committed to cultivating a work environment of respect and kindness. We carefully consider every applicant that takes the time to apply.
