items.title: Senior Support Engineer - APAC Region
items.content:
YOUR IMPACT

As a Senior Support Engineer at CircleCI you will have an impact every day by working directly with our customers to help them get the best from the CircleCI platform. You’ll be working directly with developers (both customers and CircleCI engineers) to help shape and improve the the product and customer experience.

ABOUT THE ROLE
This is a full-time, remote position. You’re someone who thrives working remotely without much (if any) oversight. You’ll be part of the Support Team which is currently ten people. We’re a fully remote team with employees around world. You’ll be a product expert in all areas. You’ll spend most of your days sending timely, human replies to questions via support tickets, but you’ll also craft documentation, troubleshoot potential bugs, and collaborate with the rest of the team to be as helpful as possible to our customers.

As a Senior Support Engineer you’ll focus on technical ‘deep-dives’ to get to the bottom of problems and create solutions. We’d rather you spent a day solving a tricky problem for an important customer than running through 30 easy tickets. You’ll be creating scripts, configuration enhancements and automating processes for customers and our internal tooling. Writing bug reports and escalations for the product and engineering teams is an important part of the role, we expect you to always act in the best interest of the customer.
You’ll be given plenty of autonomy to simply do what’s right, no questions asked.

With great power comes great responsibility.
As someone on the front line, your understanding of the product and our customers is incredibly valuable. You’ll be able to share knowledge with the product team to make sure we’re getting it right.
We believe that sustainable growth for CircleCI is a byproduct of putting our customers and their needs, first. You’ll be actively collaborating with the customer success, customer engineering and product teams to help our customers.

About CircleCI
Velocity is critical for software teams in today's competitive landscape, but maintaining speed can be difficult as apps and systems grow larger and more complex. CircleCI’s platform allows developers to rapidly release code (for web and mobile apps) they trust by automating the build, test, and deploy process. CircleCI enables developers to detect and fix bugs before they even reach customers. Thousands of leading companies including Facebook, Kickstarter, Shyp and Spotify rely on CircleCI to accelerate delivery of their code and enable developers to focus on creating business value fast.

CircleCI is a Bay Area Best Places to Work 2016 award winner. Founded in 2011 and headquartered in beautiful downtown San Francisco with a global remote workforce, CircleCI is venture backed by Scale Venture Partners, DFJ, Baseline Ventures and Harrison Metal Capital.
CircleCI has a remote team with employees around the world and in our San Francisco and Toronto offices.

For details about our technology stack please see this StackShare post by our CTO: https://stackshare.io/circleci/how-circleci-processes-4-5-million-builds-per-month

Requirements:
  • We’re looking for someone who can work hours that overlap with Asia Pacific time zones.
  • Because we value work-life balance and creating a sustainable position, we prefer if you are geographically located in an equivalent timezone to UTC +13 to UTC +8 (so you do not need to zone-shift or work far outside of normal business hours where you live).
  • This job is Monday-Friday, full-time in your timezone (hours are flexible but we prefer it if you can keep a regular pattern)

Are you empathetic to developers and love to problem-solve? We’d love to talk to you if:

  • You are self-sufficient and love the challenge of solving problems and learning new things.
  • You welcome an environment where you can do great work independently.
  • You’re patient and resilient, with an excellent sense of humor.
  • You’re an exceptional listener and educator, and you’re naturally curious with a strong desire to learn.
  • You’re an effective communicator, fluent in written English.
  • Your writing is clear and simple. You’re confident with humility and empathy.
  • You have determination and take initiative and ownership to see things through to completion. If it needs doing, you do it.
  • You aren’t scared of a challenge. When you don’t know something, you embrace the chance to grow and get better.
  • You have strong Linux / Unix based operating system knowledge. Bash and shell scripting skills are invaluable.
  • You have experience with a range of web and application development stacks and ecosystems, such as Ruby, Python, PHP, JavaScript, Java, iOS and Android.
  • You’re familiar with the ecosystems around these stacks (their frameworks, dependency management tools and deployment options).
  • You’re familiar with relational and non-relational databases and their configuration options.
  • You’re experienced with Git and Github / Bitbucket.
  • You’ve worked with Docker and container based technologies.
  • You’re comfortable searching and reading log files to locate the source of problems.
  • Have some knowledge of Unit Testing and Test Driven Development.
  • Have some knowledge of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery methodologies.

To apply: If you’re interested in joining the team, please follow the link above to send us your resume and a cover letter explaining why you’d be a great fit. If you have an easily accessible presence on the web (Twitter, blog, Github, LinkedIn, etc.) please share it.We care deeply about diversity and inclusivity. We’re hiring at all experience levels, and seek talented teammates from a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences who are equally committed to cultivating a work environment of respect and kindness. We carefully consider every applicant that takes the time to apply.

items.title: Nugg: Editor-in-Chief at High-Growth Cannabis Tech Startup
items.content:
Editor-in-Chief at High-Growth Cannabis Tech Startup

Posted Nov 20

Nugg
Headquarters: Los Angeles
www.getnugg.com

Nugg is one of the hottest startups in the $30-50 billion cannabis space. If you are passionate about joining a dynamic company that is already a leader in it’s industry (and has massive growth potential), Nugg is the right place for you.

We are seeking a full-time Editor-in-Chief to 1) ensure all our content efforts are on-brand and resonate with our target audiences, and 2) obsess over improving KPI's and conversions for blog content.

WHAT YOU’LL BE CHARGED WITH:

We are looking for a rockstar writer, editor and curator who knows how to use technical platforms to find and deliver rich, brand building content. This includes a thorough understanding of SEO best practices, content curation & management, conversion rate optimization, and an expert understanding of best copywriting principles, consumer psychology, storytelling, emotional value, and more to support and advance our editorial calendar and mission.

HOURS & LOCATION:

This is a full-time (40 hours/week) position that can be completed 100% remotely, but if you’re in the Los Angeles area, you’ll be expected to work out of our Marina Del Rey office twice per week. This is an independent contractor position to start, with a 3-month evaluation period prior to transitioning into a salaried position.

COMPENSATION: $45,000 - $65,000 annual salary, depending on experience.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

--Manage our team of writers who contribute to the blog, including communicating, answering questions, ensuring deadlines are met, providing article feedback, ensuring style guidelines are adhered to, and more
--Work alongside our Content Marketing Director and CMO to refine blog content strategy, optimize content curation/creation systems for greater output and efficiency, as well as optimize our blog as a channel for lead-generation and conversion from reader to customer
--Create our editorial calendar, and manage production & publishing of content to various platforms
---Conduct ongoing tests to pinpoint what storylines, tone, imagery, CTA’s etc. resonate best with our target audiences on various platforms where we publish content
--Collaborate with our designer(s) to craft compelling infographics, hero images, and more that’ll engage our readers

ESSENTIAL SKILLS

-- An arsenal of words and phrases written for successful blog posts, email campaigns, and social media posts, preferably for 3+ years in a professional setting.
-- 2-5 years of content creation experience, with ability to integrate SEO best practices
-- Proven experience creating online content with current portfolio (web content, blogs, campaigns, social media, video, etc.)
-- 3+ years managing a content team and editorial calendar, able to stay on schedule & meet deadlines consistently
-- Experience working with a graphic designer to create rich, brand-building content
-- Self-starter, highly motivated to succeed under minimal supervision.
-- Very web-savvy and up-to-date with developing tools and methods.
-- Experience and/or passion for cannabis is preferred.

COMPANY OVERVIEW:

Based in Los Angeles, we’re the nation’s largest online cannabis marketplace. We provide quick, easy, and professional access to medical marijuana delivery for people in California, and have ambitious plans to offer our services throughout the entire United States.

The other arm of our business, NuggMD, is the nation’s leading telemedicine platform for cannabis, connecting potential cannabis users with licensed doctors via live video to make getting a doctor’s recommendation for medical cannabis quick and painless.

NuggMD is the leading telemedicine platform for cannabis evaluations, has served over 100,000 people in California and New York, and will be available in more states soon.

BENEFITS & CULTURE:

We’re a half-remote, half Los Angeles local team, and that’s just the way we like it. At Nugg, you can work whenever, wherever, however, as long as you get your shit done. We’re a laid-back team that enjoys ping pong, Saturday brunch, the outdoors, house music, and the little things in life.

As our newest team member, you’ll be given full autonomy to execute on your ideas. You’ll get as many vacation days as you want, and we’ll even vacation together (Colombia next spring, yo!) At Nugg, you’ll have boatloads of fun, while testing the limits of your expertise and innovative capacities. At Nugg, life gets a little better each day.

Apply for this position

Fill out the application here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1QIFU-1M8P5w1cmXoseYNymRnnqBPqAO13_o5pTSObMo

items.title: Nugg: Digital marketer / Biz dev rockstar for cannabis tech startup
items.content:
Digital marketer / Biz dev rockstar for cannabis tech startup

Posted Nov 20

Nugg
Headquarters: Los Angeles
www.getnugg.com

Nugg is one of the hottest startups in the $30-50 billion cannabis space. If you are passionate about joining a dynamic company that is already a leader in it’s industry (and has massive growth potential), Nugg is the right place for you.

We are seeking a full-time Digital Marketer / BD rockstar to 1) create and leverage relationships with influencers and online communities to drive customer acquisition 2) build and manage relationships with press and media to advance our PR initiatives 3) growth-hack the internet to find tangible, measurable new avenues for growth.

WHAT YOU’LL BE CHARGED WITH:

We’re looking for a crafty digital marketer who knows how to use technical platforms to leverage the audiences of others to spur growth, and whose lifeblood is building meaningful relationships online. This includes a thorough understanding of influencer marketing, community engagement, relationship-building, and deal-making.

HOURS & LOCATION:

This is a full-time (40 hours/week) position that can be completed 100% remotely, but if you’re in the Los Angeles area, you’re welcome to work out of our Marina Del Rey office. This is an independent contractor position, with the potential to shift into a full-time role based on performance.

COMPENSATION:  $25-35 per hour, depending on experience.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

--Craft relationships and partnerships with our industry’s most impactful influencers to distribute content, generate affiliate deals, and create sustainable growth

--Build meaningful relationships with popular journalists, bloggers, and members of the press to advance our image as thought leaders and generate reliable, repeat channels for distributing content, company stories & announcements, and other branded media

--Identify the best online communities for engaging with our existing and potential customers and find new ways to deliver them value, curate ideas for content, and make our brand known

--find sustainable channels for promoting and distributing our content online

ESSENTIAL SKILLS

-- Proven experience identifying and seizing opportunities for online partnerships and collaborations that create real, sustainable growth

-- A love for experimentation, measuring results, and iteration

-- A solid understanding of human psychology, negotiation, and deal-making

-- 2-5 years of digital marketing experience

-- Self-starter, highly motivated to succeed under minimal supervision.

-- Very web-savvy and up-to-date with developing tools and methods.

-- Experience and/or passion for cannabis is preferred.

COMPANY OVERVIEW:

Based in Los Angeles, we’re the nation’s largest online cannabis marketplace. We provide quick, easy, and professional access to medical marijuana delivery for people in California, and have ambitious plans to offer our services throughout the entire United States.

The other arm of our business, NuggMD, is the nation’s leading telemedicine platform for cannabis, connecting potential cannabis users with licensed doctors via live video to make getting a doctor’s recommendation for medical cannabis quick and painless.

NuggMD is the leading telemedicine platform for cannabis evaluations, has served over 100,000 people in California and New York, and will be available in more states soon

BENEFITS & CULTURE:

We’re a half-remote, half Los Angeles local team, and that’s just the way we like it. At Nugg, you can work whenever, wherever, however, as long as you get your shit done. We’re a laid-back team that enjoys ping pong, Saturday brunch, the outdoors, house music, and the little things in life.

As our newest team member, you’ll be given full autonomy to execute on your ideas. You’ll get as many vacation days as you want, and we’ll even vacation together (Columbia next spring, yo!) At Nugg, you’ll have boatloads of fun, while testing the limits of your expertise and innovative capacities. At Nugg, life gets a little better each day.

Apply for this position

items.title: Java Developer (100% Remote in France or Germany) at PeopleDoc (Paris, France) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer, Backend Developer
Industry: HR Services, SaaS
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Job Description/ Job Summary:

PeopleDoc is looking for experienced and talented developers who love working with microservice architecture built on top of a Lot of Java/Dropwizard & more and more Scala/Play. PeopleDoc has been growing like crazy during the last 4 years, and hopefully it’s not going to stop! The R&D teams is always in the process of improving our application for our users and supporting the incredible growth of PeopleDoc.

 In this role, you will work closely with product owners, UX developers, SRE, DBAs, Support teams, and other web engineers to push forward the implementation of new features while also helping us to scale our platform. As a member of one of our feature teams, you will join a friendly and talented group of Java developers, within a dynamic, forward looking company, facing great engineering challenges.

Our stack includes: Java, Scala, PlayFramework, Python/Django, PostgreSQL, Redis, ElasticSearch, RabbitMQ, Ansible, ember.js

The successful candidate will be required to:

  • Design, ship and test new features in collaboration with the Product Team
  • Use your deep understanding of web technologies and APIs to advise on the system's architecture
  • Push your code in production, improve our deployment process and monitor it
  • Analyze, rethink and refactor the code to scale the application
  • Write unit, functional and performances tests
  • Contribute to our OpenSource Projects

Skills & Requirements

Competencies required:

  • The ability to write tested, production grade Java 8 code
  • Extensive SQL skills
  • A solid understanding of Linux development and automation tools (we use Ansible to manage configuration, and you are expected to deploy your own application and features)
  • Like to learn & share, you are passionate and humble about your skills
  • Be user focused – ultimately, we are are working for our users
  • Excellent communication skills. As a team and “international company” we communicate mostly in English, but R&D is based in Paris, so French is mandatory
  • Computer Science degree is viewed favorably

About PeopleDoc

Here are PeopleDoc, we believe that employees should receive the same level of services as the company’s best customers. Our unique “state of the art” HR Service Delivery platform provides HR teams with the tools they need to provide a great services while considerably decreasing the manual work behind the scenes and allowing companies to go paperless in their administration.

The PeopleDoc HR Service Delivery platform helps HR teams more easily answer employee requests on demand, automate employee processes, and manage compliance across multiple locations. Our cloud solutions include case management, process automation and employee file management. 100% software as a service, PeopleDoc solutions integrate with existing HR systems, can be implemented in 8-12 weeks, and are designed for agile ongoing use by HR teams serving diverse workforces. PeopleDoc serves more than 500 clients with employees in 165 countries in nine languages with a 100% customer retention rate. More information is available at http://www.people-doc.com.  ;

Our solutions:

  • HR Service Delivery platform
  • Employee File Management
  • Case Management & Employee Portal with personalized knowledge base
  • Process Automation
  • Advanced Analytics

Benefits

Great equipment (choice of Mac or Lenovo)
Employee Stock Option Plan
Flex Office
Allowance for Training/Seminars
Health Plan
New Office located in the heart of Paris
Generous Vacation Plan (25 vacation + 10 RTT)
Subsidized Meal Tickets
Subsidized Commuting

items.title: Java Software Engineer (Backend) at Megalytic () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Business Intelligence, Data & Analytics

Job description

We are hiring a Backend Java Engineer to join the Megalytic software engineering team. Megalytic is an innovative SaaS product providing data visualization, integration, dashboarding, report building, and report distribution for digital marketing professionals.

As a Java Engineer, you will be a major contributor to the backend development of Megalytic. You’ll work directly with the company co-founders to get us to the “next level” and implement a major upgrade of our successful product. You will implement new features from scratch, as well as improve the existing codebase. You will work on integrating a wide variety of 3rd party analytics APIs such as Google Analytics, AdWords, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, etc.  This is an exciting opportunity to take part in designing and rebuilding an architecture from the group up.

We are a geographically distributed team. That means you will work remotely and communicate with us on a daily basis using Slack, Skype and other collaborative technologies. This job definitely offers the shortest commute you will ever have to make!

You will be responsible to:

  • Take part in designing and implementing 3rd party API integration architecture.
  • Build upon the new system to integrate new data sources.
  • Maintain and improve the existing backend Java code.
  • Work with the VP of Engineering to implement robust and scalable Java solutions that integrate with our full product stack.

Skills & requirements

You need to be a serious Java programmer for this position.  In particular, passionate about backend work. These skills are required:

  • 5+ years coding with pure Java (Groovy / Scala is fine, but must have prior pure java experience).
  • Experience with Java build tools such as Maven / Gradle / Ant.
  • Highly committed and experienced with writing tests (TDD is a plus).
  • Demonstrated ability to design complex, scalable, backend solutions.
  • Experience with 3rd party RESTful APIs such as Google Analytics, AdWords, Facebook Insights, and Twitter Analytics is a plus.
  • Experience with Concurrency, Rate Limiting, Jackson (JSON data binding), Servlets, and Tomcat.
  • Fluent with Git (GitHub) and working as part of a distributed development team.

About Megalytic

Megalytic is a startup that is revolutionizing the world of digital marketing reporting. Our software has been purchased by over 800 digital marketing agencies serving small and medium businesses. These agencies save substantial staff, time, and money by using Megalytic to automate marketing campaign performance reports. Megalytic is implemented as a cloud-based solution (i.e., SaaS) that integrates data from multiple sources including Google Analytics, AdWords, and Facebook.

The atmosphere at Megalytic is informal and hours can be flexible as long as the work gets done, deadlines are met, and customers are happy.

Benefits

Remote Work
Fun People

items.title: Senior Distributed Database Engineer at Stardog Union (Arlington, VA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Databases, Enterprise Software, Information Technology
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Stardog is the world's leading Knowledge Graph platform for the Enterprise. Turn data into knowledge faster and easier. Stardog lets you query, search, and analyze enterprise data, wherever it is, using scalable, cutting-edge Knowledge Graph technology.

The future has always been distributed and the future is arriving now. If you know that Raft isn't just a flotation device, then you could be a great fit for Stardog.

Responsibilities:

  • Help design and build storage and query evaluation over a large distributed database
  • Develop and implement algorithms for distributed transactions over very large clusters
  • Implement and optimize graph algorithms over distributed indexes 
  • Work on integration with DCOS frameworks like Mesos

Skills & Requirements

  • 5+ years programming experience, ideally in Java
  • Strong computer science fundamentals, with advanced knowledge of data structures, algorithms and software design
  • Experience building distributed databases and service-oriented architectures
  • Knowledge of Spark, Storm, Flink, DCOS frameworks like Mesos
  • Ability to work in a distributed team mainly communicating over email, chat, and phone
  • Experience with graph technologies or databases is a plus

About Stardog Union

Our culture is based on engineering excellence, mutual respect, collegiality in all things, rigor in design, research, implementation, and testing. We care deeply about work-life balance and productivity in the short and long run. In sum, if you remove the unnecessary, the distracting, and the tedious, what you're left with is a healthy 40 hour week full of wins

We are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Benefits

Health care including dental & vision, some plans fully company paid
401k
3 weeks vacation
Remote work available for qualified candidates
Top of the line hardware
Flexible work schedule
Company paid life and disability benefits
Well stocked kitchen, snacks, lunch, and most importantly, coffee

items.title: GCP Architects and Engineers at Impekable (Irvine, CA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Design, Enterprise Software, Technology Consulting
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Impekable is actively looking for talented engineers familiar with developing and/or architecting complex solutions utilizing the diverse offerings afforded by Google Cloud Platform (GCP).  We are seeking multiple candidates experienced in planning, implementing, monitoring and servicing/maintaining robust cloud offerings.  Architect related needs are local to Irvine, CA and will require on-site collaboration.  Engineering positions are telecommute capable, but require stringent adherence to Impekable's standards for remote workers.  Currently, as opportunities require a senior level knowledge and will expect commensurate communication prowess and mature understanding of project lifecycles.  Each role has some unique aspects we're looking for, detailed below, as well as a set of general attributes relevant to all roles.   In the first word of your reply, respond with your favorite color so we can confirm you have completely read this or your submission will be immediately discarded.    

Architecture:

  • 3+ years experience designing and planning GCP solutions.
  • Familiar with managing and provisioning infrastructure.
  • Designing for security and compliance
  • Responsible for designing optimal GCP architecture, in line with the MDM, micro-services and AppEngine designs
  • Analyzing and optimizing technical and business processes.
  • Managing implementation across multiple environments
  • Ensuring solution and operations reliability
  • Provide subject matter expertise around technical infrastructure and applications.
  • Define the business case for solutions
  • Assist in prototyping and development of new environments
  • Guide solutions through launch to market
  • Demonstrate thought leadership in cloud computing across multiple channels
  • Provide reliable context and details to decision makers
  • Provide customer and market feedback to the product and engineering teams
  • Assist in shaping product direction

DevOps Architecture:

  • Comfortable with a range of programming and scripting languages
  • Experience using the typical Unix/Linux toolbox of software and management tools
  • Experience with large scale distributed systems in production
  • Good knowledge of internet networking and performance
  • Passionate about troubleshooting, debugging, and automation
  • Strong Linux knowledge
  • Knowledge of best practices and tooling
  • Experience with clustering and containerization technologies
  • Release and Versioning Strategy Design
  • CI/CD pipeline and toolchain overlay design
  • Mentorship and Pair Programming for:
    • DevOps practices and principles
    • Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
    • Continuous Improvement/Integration
    • Continuous Delivery
  • Application Portfolio Management
  • Familiar with Environment Scoping

Engineering:

  • Write server side code for Google Cloud Platform based applications
  • Create robust high-volume production applications
  • Familiar with rapid prototyping techniques and fast iterations
  • Build, design and implement scalable cloud-based web applications for PaaS, IaaS or SaaS.
  • Provide thought leadership for cloud developer technology
  • Collaborate with cross-functional engineering teams to streamline or improve application
  • Application Portfolio Management
  • Familiar with Environment Scoping
  • Ability to refactor existing designs

General Expectations:

  • Master Data Management Design with GCP Architecture and Software Engineering
  • Micro-services Architecture Design and AppEngine Design with GCP Architect and Software Engineering
  • Excellent communications
  • Personal ownership and commitment to excellence
  • Deep knowledge of Google Cloud Platform
  • Location
    • Architecture: local to Irvine, CA
    • Engineering: remote, available during PST schedule
  • US Citizen, currently residing in the continental US

About Impekable

We are a SaaS web and mobile design and development studio based in the San Francisco Bay area, California. We help organizations from startups to Fortune 1000 companies create memorable, human-centric experiences or solve business problems. We are an official Google Vendor and partnered with Twilio, and Aruba Networks.

Our Values

Clients keep coming back to us because we are driven towards building good relationships by putting their needs first.

Whether it is helping the early stage startup get their foot off the ground or bringing new perspective for more established corporations, we believe in helping our clients as much as possible.

We believe in creating quality design and development that is effective in achieving our client’s goals. Our work has helped our clients achieve worldwide recognition as a Best New App and mentions on large publications.

Impekable Team

Our team is made up of creative, multi-talented individuals from different walks of life. Each member combines their knowledge of design, development, and problem-solving abilities to create a compelling user experience that suits every unique product.

Our tight-knit company culture ensures that our office is a place where creativity can thrive and our client’s ideas can prosper.

We do this by bringing out the best of their product, which includes applying emerging trends and technologies together for all of our partners from a wide variety of technology industries including e-commerce, drones, and Internet of Things.

Benefits

Ability to work remotely (US & abroad)
Flexible hours
Flexibility for part time workers
Opportunity to work on diverse and interesting projects
Exposure to latest technology
Empowerment to do the job the way you think is best
Competitive compensation
Room for growth

  • Demonstrated effective and successful verbal and written communication skills
  • Bachelor degree in Computer Science or related technological degree
  • U.S. citizen

Desired Qualifications

  • Experience building and coding applications using Hadoop components – HDFS, HBase, Hive, Sqoop, Flume, Spark, etc
  • Experience building and maintaining Cloudera-based clusters
  • Full life cycle software application development experience
  • Experience with unstructured datasets, such as log files, email, text
  • Experience with geospatial datasets and datastores

Benefits

Cutting edge technology

Work from home options
Social activities and events
Competitive salary and bonuses
Business casual attire
Collaborative environment

items.title: Senior DevOps / SysAdmin / Site Reliability Engineer (Freelancer) at Centralway Numbrs AG (Zürich, Schweiz) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: DevOps, System Administrator
Industry: Finance
Company size: 51-200 people

Job description

Responsibilities include but are not limited to deploying, supporting, monitoring and troubleshooting large scale micro-service based distributed systems with high transaction volume; documenting the IT infrastructure, policies, and procedures. Applicants are also expected to participate in after-hours work.

  • a Bachelor's or higher degree in technical field of study
  • 10+ years of experience in managing and troubleshooting large scale distributed systems
  • 5+ years in JVM
  • 2+ years in AWS
  • 2+ years in Docker, Kubernetes and Mesos
  • 3+ years in  setting up, configuring and monitoring Kafka and Zookeeper in production
  • 5+ years experience in operating relational (Oracle, PostgreSQL, MySQL) and noSQL (Couchbase, Cassandra) storages
  • excellent knowledge of at least one modern programming language, such as Go, Java, C++, Python and Scala
  • a good understanding of network and routing protocols (TCP/IP, DNS and others)
  • excellent troubleshooting and creative problem-solving abilities
  • excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills
  • experience implementing, operating, and supporting open source tools for network and security monitoring and management on Linux/Unix platforms
  • experience with encryption and cryptography standards

Location: Onsite in Zurich, Switzerland. Remote work possible for exceptionally good candidates.

About Centralway Numbrs AG

Centralway’s focus is on developing products to manage banking transactions and assets. The platform provides banking services for the consumer, as well as the development and implementation of banking software towards financial institutions. We are currently looking for a Backend Engineer, at the earliest possible start date, to strengthen our position in the industry.

What we offer

  • Technology - Only the most cutting-edge technologies are used and we are constantly innovating. Our technical architecture is based on the use of Microservices, a block chain technology, and a proprietary machine learning technology.
  • Self-development - We offer to our employees a clear career chances by offering an experts and manager career path that ensures equal development opportunities.
  • Work / life balance - Work/life balance is important to us, which is why we offer flexible work schedules.
  • Salary - We offer highly competitive salaries. Our salary formula adjusts to your experience and cost of living.

Benefits

free breakfast, lunch and snacks
coffee and drinks
pool and kicker
modern workplace
paid vacation

items.title: AEM Developer - Nivid Technologies - Remote
items.content:
AEM Developer
Nivid Technologies -Remote
Contract

Job Summary

Hi,

We are looking for AEM Developer for one of our client . If you are interested, send me your word copy of resume with contact details.

Role: AEM Developer

Location: Remote

Duration: 2.5 months

Our Client, a manufacturing company located in South Burlington, VT is in need of an AEM Development Lead to work remotely for a 2.5 month contract. The AEM Development Lead will be supporting a project aiming to extend AEM to hold website frameworks for four our client’s products. The AEM Development Lead will provide the template and frameworks to a third party agency so they can design the website.

Day to day tasks include: Conducting infrastructure reviews of existing AEM and documenting recommendations to make it optimal to host AEM sites; Multi-site configuration for our client’s various brands; Dispatcher Cache Configuration; Development and Deployment Workflow; Point of Concept of our client’s brand websites; Developing AEM Responsive Templates for the client’s third party; Developing generic components and pages; Producing Technical Design Documentation; Assisting with DAM (Digital Asset Management) backlog (15% of the job) which will include bug fixes and enhancements.

Required Skills

  • 8-10 years of software development experience in Java based Web Applications in an agile environment
  • 5 years of experience working with content management technologies
  • Expertise in Adobe AEM Framework 6.2 or greater
  • Experience in a support time role for AEM DAM (Digital Asset Management) for bug fixes and enhancements
  • Deep knowledge of AEM Core components Sling, OSGI, JCR, Dispatcher
  • Experience designing content models, security models, workflows and templates
  • Experience developing AEM in a multi-site deployment for microsites or landing pages
  • Experience setting up AEM development (Eclipse or IDEA) and deployment practices with Maven, and Jenkins
  • Experience translating business requirements into AEM specific implementation specification
  • In-depth experience with UI technologies HTML, JSP, CSS and JavaScript
  • Must reside in the North East and able to travel to South Burlington, VT 10% of the time.

Thanks & Regards

Moiz Ahmed

Phone: 703 853 1803 Ext: 108

Job Type: Contract

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • AEM Developer: 9 years

items.title: Data scientist (mid/senior level) - Europe
items.content:
Data scientist (mid/senior level) - Europe - Jobmote

Data scientist (mid/senior level) - Europe

Real Audience

Real Audience is a Swedish tech company within the Artificial Intelligence / Big Data field, focusing on collecting and storing specific site data, do calculations on the data and help our customers to take actions based on the computed predictions.

Now we are looking to strengthen our remote team with a talented data scientist. Your responsibilities will be to develop and maintain the algorithms that are being used for data processing throughout the system. In addition you will do ad-hoc data analysis, anomaly detection, track performance and contribute to the overall development of our products.

We write functional code in Clojure/Scala, but Java and working JVM knowledge is a great foundation - we will leave room for you to develop skills in the languages that are new to you. As we try to get the team to meet from time to time, we look for people that live in Central or Eastern European countries.

You should have a sense for:

  • selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques
  • data mining using state-of-the-art methods

  • taking care of company’s data including addition of third party sources of information, enhancing data collection procedures, processing and verifying the integrity of data

  • working with agile methodology, such as Scrum

  • working from home in a remote team

Ideally, you should have:

  • an excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms
  • experience with common data science toolkits and data visualisation tools
  • good understanding of Clojure/Scala/Java development and JVM
  • a university degree in math, technology, science or other relevant areas
  • impressive statistics and programming skills
  • knowledge of Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, Amazon AWS
  • experience with data modelling using CQL/SQL query languages
  • an interest in high software quality
  • at least five years of professional background

Additionally, you:

  • seek to understand the business strategy and needs of our customers
  • inspire your colleagues with your thirst for mastering the things you work with
  • are a passionate data scientist with data-oriented personality, proud of the quality of your work
  • are an independent worker and self-starter, as the job is fully remote
  • have great communication skills in spoken and written English
  • are willing to travel to Sweden, Poland, Norway or other European countries for occasional in person meetings with the team
  • live in Europe (for example Poland, Bulgaria, Ukraine, Croatia, Portugal etc.), where we currently have developers

Bonus points for:

  • an interesting Github profile, or proven track record of open source contributions

We offer:

  • an amazing opportunity to work with, and create cutting edge technology within the area of machine learning and artificial intelligence!
  • work in the Amazon AWS environment with a modern technology stack, such as Cassandra, Spark, Kafka, ElasticSearch
  • no technical dept
  • stable company with a Scandinavian client base, with the intent to expand to the rest of the world
  • a great and experienced remote team
  • a permanent full time contract, with a fixed monthly payment (on invoice)
  • salary range €3000 - €5000

items.title: Real Audience: Data scientist (mid/senior level) - Europe
items.content:
Data scientist (mid/senior level) - Europe

Posted Nov 16

Real Audience
Headquarters: Stockholm, Sweden
http://realaudience.se

Real Audience is a Swedish tech company within the Artificial Intelligence / Big Data field, focusing on collecting and storing specific site data, do calculations on the data and help our customers to take actions based on the computed predictions.

Now we are looking to strengthen our remote team with a talented data scientist. Your responsibilities will be to develop and maintain the algorithms that are being used for data processing throughout the system. In addition you will do ad-hoc data analysis, anomaly detection, track performance and contribute to the overall development of our products.

We write functional code in Clojure/Scala, but Java and working JVM knowledge is a great foundation - we will leave room for you to develop skills in the languages that are new to you. As we try to get the team to meet from time to time, we look for people that live in Central or Eastern European countries.

You should have a sense for:
  • selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques
  • data mining using state-of-the-art methods
  • taking care of company’s data including addition of third party sources of information, enhancing data collection procedures, processing and verifying the integrity of data
  • working with agile methodology, such as Scrum
  • working from home in a remote team

Ideally, you should have:
  • an excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms
  • experience with common data science toolkits and data visualisation tools
  • good understanding of Clojure/Scala/Java development and JVM
  • a university degree in math, technology, science or other relevant areas
  • impressive statistics and programming skills
  • knowledge of Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, Amazon AWS
  • experience with data modelling using CQL/SQL query languages
  • an interest in high software quality
  • at least five years of professional background

Additionally, you:
  • seek to understand the business strategy and needs of our customers
  • inspire your colleagues with your thirst for mastering the things you work with
  • are a passionate data scientist with data-oriented personality, proud of the quality of your work
  • are an independent worker and self-starter, as the job is fully remote
  • have great communication skills in spoken and written English
  • are willing to travel to Sweden, Poland, Norway or other European countries for occasional in person meetings with the team
  • live in Europe (for example Poland, Bulgaria, Ukraine, Croatia, Portugal etc.), where we currently have developers

Bonus points for:
  • an interesting Github profile, or proven track record of open source contributions

We offer:
  • an amazing opportunity to work with, and create cutting edge technology within the area of machine learning and artificial intelligence!
  • work in the Amazon AWS environment with a modern technology stack, such as Cassandra, Spark, Kafka, ElasticSearch
  • no technical dept
  • stable company with a Scandinavian client base, with the intent to expand to the rest of the world
  • a great and experienced remote team
  • a permanent full time contract, with a fixed monthly payment (on invoice)
  • salary range €3000 - €5000

Apply for this position

Please send your application together with CV and relevant links (open source contributions, Github/Stack Overflow accounts, public projects, code samples etc.) to Real Audience AB. Please also state clearly in which country you reside and will work from. Email address for applications: datascientist2017@realaudience.se

items.title: Backend Java Developer - Casumo - (Malta / Barcelona / Remote (from EU zone)) - FullTime
items.content:
• Casumo (Malta / Barcelona / Remote (from EU zone))
  • Fulltime Job

    • Backend Java Developer

    Full time / Experienced

    What would be your role?

    Casumo is agile so we expect you to take on a broad spectrum of tasks. Together we will work to realize our dreams and visions of how the world’s best gaming site should look and work. We are looking for developers who are driven and won’t say no to a challenge but also they have to care for what they do as we expect taking responsibility for the code written.

    Who are you?

    Someone who likes to work in a flat organization.

    Someone who enjoys autonomy.

    Driven and motivated.

    A team player.

    Willing to work out of our offices in Malta or Barcelona, or on remote as part of our distributed workforce.

    A nice person that can bear conversations about unicorns.

    A Backend Java Developer at Casumo:

    Is native in Java, but speaks and writes Bash, SQL and Python. If you have any experience with Kotlin, Scala or Javascript it’s not impossible that you’ll get to practice that too.

    Has an interest both in the big picture and for the small details, a key to work in our tightly knit team.

    Likes freedom with responsibility and would feel comfortable in an environment of developer anarchy.

    Has a desire to take full ownership of features and code, from inception of ideas to deployment, maintenance and keeping it running.

    Appreciates the concepts and principles underlying open-source culture and good software development.

    Is a person who loves to play with code, understands the need of quality and cares about it

    Gets curious when we say CQRS, Event Sourcing or MicroServices. Feels very comfortable in a Linux environment and working with tools like Git.

    It’s a plus if you have experience with transaction-heavy, distributed systems, messaging, MicroServices or tools such as MySQL, RabbitMQ, Docker, Spring, Dropwizard or Jenkins/TeamCity.

    Would be stoked to build the world’s best gaming experience together with other Casumos from our headquarters in sunny Malta, Barcelona or on remote.

    About Casumo:

    Casumo is a recognized and award-winning online casino formed in 2012. We’re a bunch of nerdy game enthusiasts who believe that the right people, tools and technology drive innovation and have the potential to disrupt entire industries. With our passion for games we’re on a mission to create a better reality for the many people through play and we’re always looking for like-minded to join our adventure.

    We’re a flat organization which means we stay away from unnecessary titles and corporate gibberish. We believe in hiring great people and get out of their way, and that’s where you come in. Being different is good, and our mantra “You’re weird, I like you”, helps us keeping things fresh, original and playful. Our work style is characterized by transparency, humbleness, speed and an entrepreneurial culture, with autonomous, cross-functional teams working closely together towards a clear vision. We never stop playing and we never stop learning. Together, we’re writing the future of gaming. Are you ready for a new adventure?

    Dreamy office locations

    Enjoy sun, beautiful surroundings and a welcoming culture

    Great health and medical plans

    If something happens to you, we’ve got your back

    Legendary company trips

    We work, twerk and celebrate our goals together with a bang

    Weekly office activities

    Join the board games club, relax with yoga, play football or just grab a cheeky Friday beer in our bar.

    Trust & Flexibility

    Work in a flat structure with inspiring colleagues and lots of room to learn and grow

    Creativity bonanza

    work with like-minded masterminds and the latest tech on building amazing things

    How to apply

Systems Architect Advisor
CSRA -Remote
Full-time, Other
Clearance Level Must Currently Possess:

Other

Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain:

Top Secret SSBI (Single Scope Background Investigation)

Suitability:

Agency Specific

Job Family:

Information Technology

Job Description:

Responsibilities / Duties:
  • Design technical architectures, services, APIs, applications and web sites to support core business and external facing products using the J2EE platform and the Java based entellitrak product.
  • Performs software development activities while leading the software development team to ensure quality and timeliness
  • Develop coding standards, techniques and best practices.
  • Contribute domain-specific expertise by reviewing code, technical architecture/design, and mentoring team members
  • Propose technical solutions of varying technologies for RFP responses/proposals and proof of concepts.
  • Applies advanced technical principles, theories and concepts. Contributes to development of new principles and concepts.
  • Works on unusually complex technical problems and provides solutions which are highly innovative and ingenious.
Required Skills:
  • Software development experience (8+ years).
  • Object Oriented Design and implementation experience (8+ years).
  • Object Oriented Design patterns application experience (8+ years).
  • Java experience (5+ years).
  • Micropact entellitrak experience (5+ years)
  • MVC framework experience with Spring, Hibernate, and/or Struts
  • Experience applying Java technologies to the development of n-tier, web-based applications (8+ years).
  • Experience designing APIs and web services (WCF) (5+ years).
  • Strong HTML5, Java, JavaScript, JQuery, SQL Server, AngularJS, and CSS development skills.
  • Experience interfacing with relational databases utilizing SQL Server and Oracle.
  • XML and ASP.Net MVC framework experience.
  • Understanding of version control and change management processes, is a must.
  • Detail-oriented with solid verbal and written communication skills.
  • Secure coding practices

Preferred Skills:
  • Unified Process and/or Agile Methodology experience.
  • Strong Microsoft .Net experience including ASP, WPF, C# and TFS (5+ years).
  • Experience with AJAX, SOAP, SOA, and DB2 stored procedures is a plus.
  • Familiar with Section 508 requirements.
  • Familiar with Linux/Unix command line environment.
  • Experience with Mobile development (Android, iOS)
  • In-depth knowledge of the background investigations and personnel security domain

Education/Experience
  • BS/BA degree in Computer Science or similar
  • 8+ years of development experience

Access/Clearance
  • Must be able to obtain and maintain a Favorably-Adjudicated SSBI

1

40

Some Telecommuting Allowed

USA VA Home Office (VAHOME)

CSRA is committed to creating a diverse environment and is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

items.title: Technical Instructor - Workday - Home Based
items.content:
Technical Instructor
Workday -Home Based
Join our team and experience Workday!

It's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they're doing. At Workday, we're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business of enterprise applications. We work hard, and we're serious about what we do. But we like to have a good time, too. In fact, we run our company with that principle in mind every day: One of our core values is fun.

Job Description

Job DescriptionWorkday's Knowledge Management group is looking for professional Instructors who have experience that runs the entire gamut of training -- from course concept to development to delivery. This position will support our Cross Application tools that include Reporting, Security, Business Process Framework and Integrations.

About the Team

Workday Education is responsible for teaching Workday’s market-leading technology to our partners and customers. Our innovation doesn’t stop with our applications. It continues in our approach to learning. Whether in our state-of-the-art classrooms or other exciting mediums, we work hard to use technology that benefits everyone. Want to learn more? Please visitwww.workdayeducation.com.About the roleAs a Workday Instructor, you will teach and certify Workday and partner consultants and customers to provide them with product expertise. You should be passionate about the quality of what you do with an intense desire to continue to make everything you are involved in better. You should also be ready to work hard but have a lot of fun doing it!You will have the ability to define the course requirements, create the course deliverables, and see the work through, including delivery of the course. This position requires the ability to collaborate with Development and Product Management to ensure accuracy of course content and use of functionality, and Professional Services and Product Support for relevancy of course offerings.You will• Become an expert in the Workday reporting and integration tools• Teach a variety of classes, both Instructor Led and Virtual Instructor Led• Collaborate with content development team to define course structure, content, and delivery method to produce high quality training• Obtain a deep knowledge of Workday applications and work across functional teams to stay current with rapidly evolving enhancements• Build relationships across teams to meet goals• Learn and quickly master new product functionality• Share your knowledge and experience with your students to get their Workday career off to a great start!This position can be located in any metro market.About YouThe ideal candidate will be able to teach the Workday reporting and integration tools to diverse audiences, including customers, implementation consultants, partners, and application developers.You should be passionate about the quality of what you do with an intense desire to continue to make everything you are involved in better. You should also be ready to work hard but have a lot of fun doing it!Our successful candidates have a strong background in full scale ERP deployments and training. They work hard, they love to learn, and they are ready for a challenge!You have• 3-5 years implementing reporting and/or integration solutions with Human Resource, Payroll or Financial ERP application software• 3+ years integrating systems with third-party service vendors• Strong technical aptitude, including designing and building reports, a command of Service Oriented Architecture Concepts, experience with EDI, Web Services, XML, XSLT, Java, .Net or other integration technologies, and WebLogic, WebSphere, WebMethods, or other middleware experience• Excellent problem solving skills and the ability to independently manage projects• Ability to communicate concepts in a concise, logical manner so students can absorb and retain• Passion for learning, teaching, and mastering complex system functionality• Ability to comfortably and confidently present to large groups of 20+ people using a variety of delivery methods, for lengthy periods of time• Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal• Ability to learn technology quickly through instruction and self-training and the flexibility to adapt to a changing environment• Preference will be given to candidates with experience designing, building, and delivering training to a technical audience.• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent, relevant working experience is required. Advanced degree preferred.• Some travel will be required (up to 25%)*LI-PF1

items.title: InVisionApp: Internal Tools Manager
items.content:
Internal Tools Manager

Posted Nov 10

InVisionApp
Headquarters: New York, NY
https://www.invisionapp.com

InVision is the world’s leading design collaboration platform.

 

We enable companies of all sizes to discover the power of design-driven product development. That’s why more than 2,000,000 designers, product managers, marketers and other stakeholders at so many of the world's most loved startups, agencies, & corporations use InVision every day, including Uber, Evernote, Twitter, Adobe, Salesforce and many more.

 

Our Internal Tooling team strives to develop and maintain high quality, scalable tools and integrations, leveraged by User Enablement, Support, Sales, Training, and other teams. Candidates should be excited at the prospect of serving those teams who so faithfully serve our customers everyday.

Requirements

  • THE CHOPS: You describe yourself as a jack-of-all-trades, thoroughly experienced and excited by modern technologies and services. You are a leader who manages through example and prides themselves on organization and results.
  • PASSIONATE ABOUT DESIGN: You understand that design makes everything possible. You are able to distinguish ‘great’ design from ‘pretty’ design. You see the difference design thinking can make in the lives of users. And you understand that even something as historically unpolished as internal tools deserve topnotch UX.
  • PROBLEM SOLVER: You enjoy learning how to solve problems in the most efficient way possible. Complexity doesn’t scare you. The challenge of distilling something complex into something simple invigorates and excites you.
  • BIASED TOWARD ACTION: You are a self-motivated, action-oriented person. You don’t sit on your hands and wait for someone else to fix a problem. If there is something you can do to make a situation better, you do it.
  • FOLLOWS THROUGH: From support staff, to product designers, to engineering – you speak the language of each of these archetypes. You are empathetic, concise, and consistent in your communication and follow-through. You ensure that the team own their commitments, collectively and personally.
  • PLAYS WELL WITH OTHERS: You recognize the strengths of your teammates and understand that we will only get where we want to go if we work together. You work with leadership to place team members on projects appropriate to their skill level and team needs.

Your Experience

  • 5+ years of experience in Product or Engineering Management (or a similar) role.
  • Experience as the direct manager of software engineers in an agile, startup environment.
  • Strong problem solving and decision-making ability, with a breadth of experience in both client-side and server-side technologies.
  • Strong proficiency preferably in Node.js; solid professional experience in one of the following backend languages: Java, Ruby, Python, PHP also preferred.
  • Preference for working in rapid development cycles (2-4 weeks).
  • Familiarity with common tools like Git, Jira, Confluence, Jenkins/CI.
  • Experience with Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery environments.
  • A proven track record of success in working with product managers, engineers, and various stakeholders to accomplish great things.
  • Familiar with modern security best practices, solutions, and technologies.
  • Understanding of the technical implications of complex and highly scalable applications.
  • The ability to dive right into a big project and manage it from start to finish.
  • Ability to thrive in a variable and demanding startup environment.
  • Comfortable in a native design environment (Sketch, Photoshop, etc.) and have a good grasp on the tools that are representative of the industry.

Responsibilities

  • You will manage a small -- yet very talented! -- team of engineers to deliver and maintain your products. Leadership responsibilities will aim to consume 20% of your time, with the remainder (80%) dedicated to frontline development.
  • You will be the internal subject matter expert and product owner for our Internal Tooling team, responsible for designing, developing, and sustaining a suite of tools and systems integrations.
  • You will manage the roadmap, refining feature ideas and maintaining existing features to drive business goals and ensure that the needs of your internal customers are being met.
  • Engage stakeholders in leadership, data, support, sales, and engineering and translate their needs into requirements for the various projects you'll oversee.
  • Coordinate across teams to maintain product and strategy alignment.
  • Invest in team growth and morale to build not just a product, but a team.
  • Adjust role specializations, process definitions, and other factors to improve scope control, quality, and velocity.
 

Benefits

InVision offers an incredibly unique work environment. The company employs a diverse team all over the world. In the United States we have teams including hubs in New York, San Francisco, Austin, Portland, and Boston. Each InVision team member is given the freedom and tools to do their best work from wherever they choose. Among our benefits we offer competitive health plans, 401k, a flexible vacation policy, unlimited Starbucks cards for each employee, and unlimited books related to your profession.

 

InVision is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Apply for this position

Apply here: https://boards.greenhouse.io/invision/jobs/906166#.WgXqcBNSx-U

items.title: Java Software Engineer - Crossover - Remote
items.content:
Java Software Engineer
Crossover -Remote
$30,000 a year - Contract
Ready to make $30,000 USD while working for a fortune 500 company from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you. Work for Crossover, and you’ll earn the most competitive wages on the market and collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field.

To qualify, you will undergo a competitive tournament-style test that will separate rockstar Engineers from the crowd. Every Saturday, we will run a tournament and rank you against hundreds of your peers. You will have from Saturday 00:00AM UTC to 23:59PM UTC to complete your testing - testing requires 3-5 hours to complete. We will then notify you if you have passed to the final round of interviews.

Job Description:

Choose Crossover and you’ll be joining our team of world class developers to handle applications as they move across tech stacks. Our team consistently creates new build processes and tackles any bugs that arise in scripts and code. Crossover’s brilliant engineers focus on solving difficult and complex technical issues, not simple bugs fixed with a quick online search. You’ll be challenged, and your technical skills will be sharpened. We are looking for new developers eager to build on their years of technical experience to contribute to our culture of cutting edge excellence.

Total compensation: $30,000/year

Location: Global (remote)

40 hours per week

Required Education and Experience:

If you want to work with the best, you have to be the best. A successful Java Engineer at Crossover will demonstrate the following qualifications:
  • A ruthless commitment to testing the code you’ve written

  • Extensive problem solving skills

  • An ability to communicate clearly regarding complex issues (in English)

  • Proficiency in the following technologies and skills is mandatory:

    • Java EE (Web Services, REST, JPA)

    • Databases (SQL server, Oracle, MySQL)

    • JUnit

    • JavaScript, HTML, XML, APIs, and JSP

    • ANT, Eclipse, and Subversion SVN

    • Linux (from the command line via SSH)

  • What to set yourself apart? Proficiency in the following technologies will make you an especially attractive candidate: Spring, NHibernate, Design patterns, noSQL

The Type of Java Engineers We’re Looking For:

Crossover values a culture of excellence. We need engineers who are not only technically proficient, but also demonstrate the following qualities:
  • A willingness to embrace the concept of iterative development as the means for building seamless products

  • A Readiness to give all the effort necessary to do an excellent job - even if it means putting in extra time to research the problem you’re facing

  • Perfectionism: knowing how a job should be done and not stopping until it’s done correctly

We’re one of the few legitimate companies offering high-paying jobs that are 100% remote, work from home. You never have to fight traffic to the office again and you have the freedom to choose when and where you put in your 40 hours to be most effective each week.

However, it is important to note that while you will work as a "contractor," these are long-term contracts that should be your only source of employment. You are not permitted to work additional jobs on the side. Please do not apply unless you are available to make this position your sole employment.

To qualify, you will undergo a competitive tournament-style test that will separate rockstar Engineers from the crowd. Every Saturday, we will run a tournament and rank you against hundreds of your peers. You will have from Saturday 00:00AM UTC to 23:59PM UTC to complete your testing - testing requires 3-5 hours to complete. We will then notify you if you have passed to the final round of interviews.To begin, please provide a resume/CV demonstrating the required experience and skills. Then, create your applicant account and come back on Saturday to complete your testing. There will be a series of online examinations and a final interview. We realize these are challenging and can require a decent amount of time so we thank you in advance for your efforts.

items.title: Android Chief Software Architect - Crossover - Remote
items.content:
Android Chief Software Architect
Crossover -Remote
$100,000 a year
Android Chief Software Architect - $50/hr

Do you have extensive experience building high traffic and large scale enterprise android apps?Are you ready to hit the ground running in a dynamic leadership role within our fast-paced environment? Do you get excited at the idea of building the future of innovation, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers, and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources?Are you eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world while earning $100,000 USD, all from the comfort of your home?If so, this role is for you.

To qualify, you will undergo a competitive tournament-style test that will separate rockstar Chief Architects from the crowd. Every Saturday, we will run a tournament and rank you against hundreds of your peers. You will have from Saturday 00:00AM UTC to 23:59PM UTC to complete your testing - testing requires 3-5 hours to complete. We will then notify you if you have passed to the final round of interviews.

Company Description:

Crossover is redefining the way people work. Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our global workforce will be built from teams collaborating from every corner of the world. We have embarked on an expedition to find and engage with that talent. Crossover has developed a unique method of finding, curating, and managing remote contractors. Our innovative contractor based model does not mean temporary - it means flexibility with global teams. Everyone is a contractor, your managers, your peers, etc. Our platform connects customers to the world’s best talent for both technical and non-technical jobs. But we don’t just find the best, we also provide the tools, training, and relationship building support to ensure success for long term growth.

At Crossover, and you’ll earn the most competitive wages on the market, collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field, and work for the most elite companies in the world.

Job Description:Join Crossover and you’ll be part of a team responsible for designing, coding, testing, debugging and maintaining various digital media applications. We strive to keep current on the latest trends in mobile technologies, so you’ll be expected to effectively lead team members and act as a technical reference.

You will explain various technologies and solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. You will develop and support front-end, online mobile product initiatives.

You will be responsible for creating and iterating excellent software applications with top quality user experience.

On a bigger scale, you will work together with other developers, engineers, and production groups to design and implement new applications, systems, and tools that are unparalleled in the market.

Responsibilities:
  • Software Development – Design and Implement new features based on customer requirements having end-to-end responsibility for delivery and quality. Drive root cause analysis of bugs and implement their fixes.

  • Requirement Analysis – Document, analyze and estimate requirements based on customer needs.

  • Process and Methodology – Work in an Agile environment and use tools such as Git, JIRA and Confluence to track development and issues related to a product.

  • Communication – Perform a key role in conference calls with global team members.

Required Skills:If you want to work with the best, you have to be the best. A successful Android Chief Architect at Crossover will demonstrate the following qualifications:
  • 5+ years of experience building high traffic and large scale Enterprise Android apps

  • 4 years of experience as a React.js developer

  • Committed to producing code that follows the best practice’s of the industry

  • Proficiency in the following skills and technologies is mandatory:

    • Java 8

    • Android Studio

    • OO programming and design patterns

    • REST API consumption

    • HTML5, JavaScript

    • WebServices and consume APIs

    • Unit testing and mobile test automation frameworks

    • Continuous integration and delivery of mobile applications

    • NoSQL and relational databases

Bonus Skills:
  • Proficiency in iOS SDK is desired but not mandatory

  • User Experience Design and Information Architecture

  • Maps (Google, ArcGis)

  • Cloud

This role may be a great fit if you have:
  • An ability to quickly and eagerly learn new technologies

  • A Willingness to take responsibility for projects and determine their trajectory

  • An ability to consistently meet deadlines even while running multiple projects

  • Excellent communication skills with a wide range of individuals (in English)

  • A collaborative approach to team projects

Total compensation: $100,000/year

Location:Global (remote)

Hours:40 productive hours per week

We’re one of the few legitimate companies offering high-paying jobs that are 100% remote, work from home. You never have to fight traffic to the office again and you have the freedom to choose when and where you put in your 40 hours to be most effective each week.

To qualify, you will undergo a competitive tournament-style test that will separate rockstar Chief Architects from the crowd. Every Saturday, we will run a tournament and rank you against hundreds of your peers. You will have from Saturday 00:00AM UTC to 23:59PM UTC to complete your testing - testing requires 3-5 hours to complete. We will then notify you if you have passed to the final round of interviews.To begin, please provide a resume/CV demonstrating the required experience and skills. Then, create your applicant account and come back on Saturday to complete your testing. There will be a series of online examinations and a final interview. We realize these are challenging and can require a decent amount of time so we thank you in advance for your efforts.

Are you up for the challenge?

items.title: Full-Stack Java Software Engineer @ Sonatype
items.content:
Full-Stack Java Software Engineer @ Sonatype

2017-11-09 00:10

Description

Sonatype’s mission is to enable organizations to better manage their software supply chain. We offer a series of products and services including the Nexus Repository Manager and Nexus Lifecycle Manager.

We are a remote and talented product development group and we work in small autonomous teams to create high quality products. Thousands of organizations and millions of developers use our software. If you have a passion for challenging problems, software craftsmanship, and having impact, then Sonatype is the right place for you.

Required Experience & Skills

  • Strong software engineering foundation and experience.
  • Strong development experience with the Java stack.
  • Experience building dynamic JavaScript-based web applications.
  • Experience working in an environment leveraging remote communication and collaboration tools (e.g. HipChat, Slack, video conferencing, wikis, Github, etc).
  • Legally authorized to work (without sponsorship) in Canada, the United Kingdom, or the United States of America and are currently residing in the corresponding country.

Desired Experience & Skills

  • Experience or knowledge of other programming languages and ecosystems is a major plus as it is relevant to the domain of our products and services (Java, Maven, C/C++, Ruby, Python, PyPI, Node.js, npm, .NET, NuGet, etc.).
  • Knowledge and experience of continuous delivery, including automated testing of various layers, containerization, automation of infrastructure provisioning and deployment, etc.
  • Knowledge and experience of relational and non-relational databases.
  • Experience developing applications deployed in Amazon Web Services.
  • Experience in an Agile development environment.
  • Experience working in a remote environment.

We are Sonatype, and we have assembled a world class team of employees, investors, and partners. We are proud to be recognized as a Deloitte Technology Fast 500 company for 2016. With more than 120,000 installations and counting, Nexus products are helping modern development organizations intelligently source, manage, assemble, and maintain open source and third-party components, so they can improve the quality, security, and speed of their software supply chains.

We are curious and constantly innovating without fear of failure. We are attacking a huge and emerging market and seeking remarkably talented individuals to join us on our journey.

Sonatype is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer that is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Country

Anywhere*

items.content:
SEEKING FREELANCER - SENIOR BACKEND ENGINEER - REMOTE OR ONSITE AT NUMBRS IN ZURICH, SWITZERLAND

About Numbrs: Numbrs is a customer-centric financial services company. It enables its customers to manage their existing bank accounts and personal finances and to buy any financial product from every provider at the best possible price. Numbrs is not a bank and will not become a bank. Numbrs is headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland and employs over 100 people. 1.5 million bank accounts are currently managed through the app in Germany and it is the #1 bank-independent banking app on iOS and Android. For more information, please visit www.numbrs.com

About the profile: Responsibilities include but are not limited to designing, developing, deploying, supporting, monitoring and troubleshooting large scale micro-service based distributed systems with high transaction volume. Applicants are also expected to participate in after-hours work.

* a Bachelor's or higher degree in technical field of study

* 10+ years of experience in building complex high volume distributed systems

* 5+ years in JAVA, expert level

* 3+ years in GO

* 2+ years hands on experience in Kafka, Spark, Storm and Flink

* 5+ years in distributed in memory cache system (Redis, Hazelcast, memcached,Ignite)

* 5+ years in micro services architecture and development

* 2+ years in gRPC and protocol buffers

* 5+ years experience in relational (Oracle, PostgreSQL, MySQL) and noSQL (Couchbase, Cassandra) storages

* 3+ years in Spring Boot framework

* excellent troubleshooting and creative problem-solving abilities

* excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills

* experience with encryption and cryptography standards

If you are interested in working for us, please send your resume to careers (at) centralway (dot) com Should you have any other questions, feel free to reach me at the given email address.

Regards, Selina

items.title: Front End Designer - Responsive UX/UI PWA
items.content:
Location: Remote

*Who are we?*

Hourstore is a new and up-and-coming start-up, creating a disruptive technology in the grocery delivery space and offering deliveries within the hour.

*Why are we different?*

Hourstores philosophy is to use technology to help local businesses and communities thrive, as well as providing our services outside of the big cities. The business strategy we have employed encourages the company to innovate in multiple areas and offers protection from competitors - *Plus we have robots!!!*

*How far have we come?*

We have just finished our live pilot with great success and are looking to take the platform to the next level rolling this out to more towns and cities.

We currently have an online platform which provides consumers with an on-demand grocery delivery experience from local stores in your area, to buy your everyday necessities at the stores low prices and receive them within the hour. We also offer a merchant platform for your local shopkeeper with the ability to offer its product online with very little hassle and cost to the store, adding value and convenience to the consumer, increasing its exposure, and most importantly increase the store's revenue.

*So where do you come in?*

With a team of developers currently working predominantly on the back-end, we need an experienced/forward thinking designer to help give the consumers a fast and fluid UX to match our speedy delivery offering. Currently we only have a web offering using responsive UI to provide cross platform connectivity, but we will be looking into mobile apps in the future. Right now, we want to build on the responsive UI and start looking into Progressive Web Apps (PWA) which will be our precursor to mobile apps, and also creating a continued branding and layout through all of our offerings.

*Our software stack features the following:*

* Java
* React.js
* PostgreSQL
* Rabbitmq
* Nginx
* Solr

The frontend uses React.js/Java but we are looking to use the right technology to provide the best user experience, eventually across multiple platforms.

*Requirements:*

* Ability to work independently across our stack
* Passion for design
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment to meet deadlines
* Collaborative team player
* The desire to work in a fast-paced, fast-changing start-up environment
* Knowledge of leading development technologies

*Benefits:*

* Competitive Salary
* Flexible working hours and location
* Part of a great team in a dynamic company experiencing high growth
* Creative freedom and out of the box thinking that aligns with our core values
