items.title: Senior UI Developer at Geisinger Health Plan, Hughes (Danville, PA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: Frontend Developer

Job description

Job summary:

Reviews, analyzes, modifies, creates, publishes, assists in design of and tests web content using web content management systems and tools. Provides key insight in design and participates in content design and site architecture discussions. Required to maintain continuing education on the ever-changing web standards. Is a key player on a multidisciplinary team and will engage in all aspects of the application development life cycle as needed for each project to be successful. Works directly with the business to ensure the project is meeting the business needs. Is expected to be a self-starter and work with minimal supervision.

Typically reports to a project leader, manager or director.

Major duties and responsibilities:

  1. *Responsible for maintaining security for employee intranet access. Processes requests from authorized personnel to grant, suspend and terminate access roles to the intranet. Maintains listing of all security administrators and users with authoring access.
  • *Enforces systemwide web policies. Manages and creates complex content and style of website, ensuring a consistent, quality presence on the web.
  • *Develops website content and design with a goal of motivating users to utilize it as a major source for information and decision-making.
  • *Assists in updates and changes to website, including content development, ensuring standards for timeliness and quality are met. Responsible for maintaining accuracy and timeliness of website information.
  • *Develops and implements strategies and design for intranet in order to maximize value to employees. Manages style of website, working collaboratively with departmental web creators to maintain consistency of style and quality of information. Develops content for corporate areas of intranet.
  • *Uses graphic and technology skills to design and produce new pages for the website. Serves as a resource in webpage creation. Ensures adherence to graphics and usability standards, editorial standards and web standards at all times.
  • *Provides help desk and other technical reference services to all users of the website. Trains and mentors business users of the Content Management tools.
  • *Executes multiple projects effectively. Keeps accurate documentation of activities and projects.
  • *Communicates clearly to express thoughts and ideas.
  • *Works collaboratively and appropriately communicates with superiors and staff. Maintains departmental service standards.
  • Maintains the confidentiality of information coming into and being disseminated from the department. Respects the privacy of individual colleagues within the department, and expects the same in return.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

*Denotes essential functions

Competencies and skills:

Demonstrates attention to detail and the ability to problem-solve through problem analysis.

Demonstrates familiarity with web architectural concepts.

Demonstrates the ability to develop effort estimates for tasks within projects.

Demonstrates the ability to learn independently. Must be able to handle on-call situations and be available 24 hours a day while serving on call.

Demonstrates excellent documentation and communication skills.

Demonstrates the ability to work independently with minimal supervision.

Education and/or experience:

Bachelor's degree or associate’s degree in computer science required.

In lieu of a degree, five years of demonstrated professional success in the area of web content management and two years of content development using the specific team technology stack may be considered equivalent to the educational requirement.

Minimum of two to four years of professional experience in web content management required.

Requires a good understanding with at least two years of professional experience in web design patterns.

General knowledge of modern programming concepts, including usability, modular design, style sheets, HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

General knowledge of modern testing practices, including regression, automated and load testing.

General knowledge of modern program design approaches, including UML, use cases and user stories.

Experience in healthcare or health payer systems is a plus.

Sitecore experience highly preferred.

If a suitably experienced candidate cannot be found, applicants who meet the basic qualifications but possess fewer years of experience will be considered for hire at a lower level. Salary would be commensurate with experience.

Working conditions/physical demands:

Remote work or work from an alternate Geisinger location may be an option after introductory period.  Occasional travel to main office may still be required. Mostly sedentary work interacting with computers and people. Requires ability to perform visual inspection and lifting less than 10 pounds.

The specific statements shown in each section of this description are not intended to be all-inclusive. They represent typical elements considered necessary to successfully perform the job.

For more information about this position please contact Heather Lazo, Talent Management Consultant at 570-808-8975 or hllazo@geisinger.edu.

About Geisinger

Geisinger Health System is an integrated health services organization widely recognized for its innovative use of the electronic health record and the development of innovative care delivery models such as ProvenHealth Navigator® and ProvenCare®. As one of the nation’s largest health service organizations, Geisinger serves more than 3 million residents throughout 45 counties in central, south-central and northeast Pennsylvania, and also in southern New Jersey with the addition of AtlantiCare, a National Malcolm Baldrige Award recipient. The physician-led system is composed of approximately 30,000 employees, including nearly 1,600 employed physicians, 12 hospital campuses, 2 research centers and a 510,000-member health plan, all of which leverage an estimated $8.9 billion positive impact on the Pennsylvania economy. Geisinger has repeatedly garnered national accolades for integration, quality and service. In addition to fulfilling its patient care mission, Geisinger has a long-standing commitment to medical education, research and community service. For more information, visit geisinger.org, or follow the latest Geisinger news and more on Twitter and Facebook.         

** Does not qualify for J-1 waiver. We are an affirmative action, equal opportunity employer. Women and minorities are encouraged to apply. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability or their protected veteran status.

items.title: Software Deconstruction Engineer aka. Infosec Consultant at Carve Systems (New York, NY) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Internet of Things, IT Security, Security
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Update November 2017: Our October hire got busy hacking quickly. We've got another hire starting in December. In response to increasing client demand for our services we are recruiting for Spring 2018 hires. That said... if you've got a different schedule in mind please apply and let us know what schedule works for you.  If you are interested in what you read below please apply and we'll get you started on the process. Thanks ...the Carve team.

What's the job?

  • Information security consulting: assessing the security of software and hardware systems.
  • Understanding how systems are built and learning how to break them.
  • Working with our experienced team on short-to-medium term engagements.

What would you do?

Every two to three weeks you'll get a new project to work on. A typical project will involve:

  • Recon: Digging into the functionality, design, and implementation of the software system or device.
  • Probing: Searching for implementation weaknesses which could indicate a security issue. This is a combination of tools that we use, tools that we build, and manual probing. For device projects this can include firmware extraction, analysis, and hardware interfacing.
  • Extending: Now that you've found a weakness... how far can you extend your access into the system?
  • Writing: Now that you've hacked your way in you'll need to write-up your findings and work with the developers to make sure they understand what the problem is and how to fix it.

If you enjoy puzzles and technical variety you'll find this job very enjoyable.

Who are we looking for?

  • You do not need to have information security experience. If you've got the right technical background and problem solving skills we can train you in the dark arts of infosec.
  • People who enjoy writing code, solving problems with code, and learning how computers work at a fundamental level.
  • This is not a "travel every week" type of consultant. We do sometimes work at a client site but most of the time we do our projects remotely.

We’re hiring for all experience levels: from zero career experience to information security veterans.

Skills & Requirements

  • Deep experience in software and computers. You may have earned this experience with a degree, career as a software developer, or perhaps you've invested in a technical hobby that took you deep into the rabbit hole.
  • Technical writing skills (English)
  • Resident of the USA and able to be employed in the USA.

We encourage remote candidates to reply *if* they are residents of the USA.

About Carve Systems

We’re a team of security consultants who do more than hack. We combine engineering and consulting expertise to act as trusted advisors to the world’s largest companies. 

Working at Carve lets you learn from some of the best and brightest in security - and they aren’t just on our team. We believe in engaging with the broader security community to stay on top of our game. You’ll have the opportunity to attend conferences, conduct research, and expand your horizons outside of project-based work. We always enjoy the endorphin rush from finally exploiting "that bug", but we make a long-term effort to master both technical and consulting skills.

We are not chained to our computers. We like to stand up and get outside. We trail run, play music, ride bikes, and enjoy well-rounded lives. We believe that wellness and happiness compounds our joys in life and leads to more success in work. We work at a long-term, sustainable pace and actively encourage and help our consultants to pursue their interests outside of security and technology.

We have offices in the New York City and consultants in Denver, Atlanta, Madrid, and Chicago but any location will do for the right candidate. Please ping us if you're interested and we look forward to answering questions about our fun interview process!

Benefits

Results Oriented Workplace
Fully paid health insurance for you and your family
Work in NYC, Colorado, or remotely
Annual training and conference budget
Time to focus: only ~1 hour of meetings/week + client meetings
All the tools you need to get the job done
Support for independent security research and speaking
Whatever vacation you need to do your best work.
Extract revenge on the software that has haunted your dreams.

items.title: Full Stack Engineer
items.content:
Full Stack Engineer - Jobmote

Full Stack Engineer

Waldo Photos

Waldo Photos  is a photo-finding platform empowering people to toss their selfie sticks, put their phones back in their pockets, and live in the moment. Waldo is the only platform that removes all of the friction in getting photos of you taken by others and creates new opportunities for photographers to market and sell their photos. Our users can enjoy life’s most precious events and automatically receive images taken of them right on their phones, or share images of others they’ve taken without having to lift a finger – whether between friends and family or a professional photographer.

We're looking for an independent problem-solver who values learning, keeps current on technology trends, and enjoys the ownership and accountability that is expected from early-stage team members. The ideal candidate will:

  • enjoy coding at all layers, focusing mainly in the backend;
  • learn whatever is necessary to get the job done;
  • write clean, elegant, simple, testable code;
  • be comfortable with git, pull requests, and code reviews;
  • take pride in their work; and
  • want to work with others who do the same.

While we're based in Austin, Texas, we have team members all across the globe. We are open to  r** emote, international, contract **employees – but we do need full-time commitment.

BASE QUALIFICATIONS

  • You've been actively coding in Python or Java for at least 5 years.
  • You have excellent algorithmic and coding skills.
  • You feel comfortable in learning and eventually using each of these, as we're developing our services in them: Python, Java, Javascript, Clojure, and Go.
  • You know how to efficiently and properly design relational databases with a deep understanding of what affects query performance.
  • You know what the conceptual difference is between PostgreSQL, Cassandra or Kafka, and RabbitMQ – which by the way, we use all of these and more!
  • "I always write tests for my code" is your middle name.
  • You thrive in a small team, high autonomy environment.

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • You have a proven track record of building and shipping complex, high-performance, highly-available distributed systems.
  • You have an experience with GraphQL and related libraries (i.e. Apollo, Relay).
  • You love leading and mentoring a team.

DETAILS

  • Ability to work remote from anywhere in the world
  • Flexible vacation
  • Unlimited (virtual) high fives
  • Type: Full-time
  • Annual salary: $80,000 - $100,000
  • Equity: 0.0% - 0.20%

items.title: Senior Backend / Chief Engineer @ Outcomes4Me
items.content:
Senior Backend / Chief Engineer @ Outcomes4Me

2017-11-03 02:25

Description

We’re looking for a senior backend /chief engineer to join our team full time, to help us create anew patient experience with the ambition to improve care. We are offering a unique opportunityto work with an experienced and passionate founding team.

Challenges we're excited about tackling:

  • Mapping and optimizing the patient experience and treatment search journey
  • Personalizing contents that addresses known and specific patient needs
  • Automatic identification of queries in patients records/profile that represent a standinginterests
  • Analyzing and modeling our search to create engaging flow
  • Empowering our users with data-informed experiences throughout their journey

We are looking for engineers with:

  • Solid engineering and coding skills
  • Experience in any of the languages Java, Python, Go
  • Experience or knowledge of Neo4j and graph algorithms
  • Experience with relational (e.g. Postgres) and Nosql (e.g. MongoDB) databases
  • Experience with cloud services/platforms (e.g., Google, Amazon) , security and HIPAAprotocols
  • Practical knowledge with agile practices, continuous software delivery, and DevOps
  • Knowledge of data processing algorithms and/or NLP is a plus

If you’re interested in applying technology to make healthcare better and have relevant skillsand experience, please send your resume to jobs@outcomes4me.com . We offer competitivecompensation and benefit packages, and for the right skill sets are open to remote workingconfigurations.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Senior Distributed Database Engineer @ Stardog
items.content:
Senior Distributed Database Engineer @ Stardog

2017-11-03 02:11

Description

Stardog is the world's leading Knowledge Graph platform for the Enterprise. Turn data into knowledge faster and easier. Stardog lets you query, search, and analyze enterprise data, wherever it is, using scalable, cutting-edge Knowledge Graph technology.

The future has always been distributed and the future is arriving now. If you know that Raft isn't just a flotation device, then you could be a great fit for Stardog.

Responsibilities:

  • Help design and build distributed storage and query evaluation over a large database cluster
  • Develop and implement algorithms for distributed transactions over very large clusters
  • Implement and optimize graph algorithms over distributed indexes
  • Work on integration with DCOS frameworks like Mesos

Requirements:

  • 5+ years programming experience, ideally in Java
  • Strong computer science fundamentals, with advanced knowledge of data structures, algorithms and software design
  • Experience building distributed databases, systems, and service-oriented architectures
  • Knowledge of Spark, Storm, Flink, DCOS frameworks like Mesos
  • Ability to work in a distributed team mainly communicating over email, chat, and phone
  • Experience with graph technologies or databases is a plus

We have offices in Arlington, VA and Boston, MA. Remote working is also possible for qualified candidates.

Our culture is based on engineering excellence, mutual respect, collegiality in all things, rigor in design, research, implementation, and testing. We care deeply about work-life balance and productivity in the short and long run. In sum, if you remove the unnecessary, the distracting, and the tedious, what you're left with is a healthy 40 hour week full of wins.

We are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Test Automation Architect - Crossover - Remote
items.content:
Test Automation Architect
Crossover -Remote
$60,000 a year - Contract
Are you an expert in Test Automation? Do you pride yourself in being 10 times more productive than the typical test architect? Are you interested in earning $60K USD, living anywhere in the world, while working for a leading technology company? If you are eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world, than this role is for you.

Company Description:Aureais partnering withCrossoverto fill this position. Crossover specializes in finding and managing the talent in today’s global workforce and will help you through the recruiting process.

Aureaenables global enterprises to create transformative experiences for their end customers across a range of industries including retail, travel & hospitality, insurance, energy, life sciences, and insurance. Aurea products enable companies to build, execute, monitor, and optimize the end-to-end customer journey across multiple channels and touchpoints to accelerate growth through an excellent customer experience. Aurea serves over 2,000 customers worldwide.

Job Description:We are seeking a technical guru who thrives in solving complex problems for customers with high expectations. The position is a great fit for someone who takes a truly hands-on approach to product development, design and engineering. It's a great opportunity to secure a high-impact technical lead role in a rapidly-growing global software company that is expanding both organically and through acquisitions. The opportunity to grow and address new challenges is infinite, as the acquisition of several new products and customer bases every year creates interesting learning opportunities for motivated professionals who strive to craft value in their work and grow personally.

We offer a fast-paced environment where you will play a dynamic technical leadership role. You will be responsible for developing test automation solutions to complex systems, establishing and implementing automated testing strategies and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources. As the owner of the technical solution, you will understand the current large enterprise product automation frameworks and identify the opportunities for optimization and improvements such as multi-threading. Contributions to the team involve resolving challenging issues with complex automation tasks/requirements. You will work with existing SMEs to understand their expertise developed over the years and become the go-to person for the teams.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Responsible for automation infrastructure that will integrate development activities with tools for metric collection and reporting

  • Set definitions and guidelines for subsystem, integration, regression and exploratory tests.

  • You will be developing expertise in our Test Automation design and implementation.

  • Bringing to bear your broad technology capabilities and maintaining a level of excitement in using various technologies to architect, develop, and iteratively deploy Test Automation.

  • Obtaining an expert level understanding of our current product environments and the use of our products.

  • Maintaining an excellent understanding of our current automation frameworks and bringing continuous improvements.

  • Solving day-to-day issues/challenges faced by the large automation teams and becoming a go-to person for any automation help.

  • Monitoring overall test execution and deep dive into the failures and work with the teams to get them fixed.

  • Creating solution architecture for new automation frameworks as required.

  • Personally accountable for resolution of the most technically challenging issues

  • Ensuring our customers are supremely confident in the advantages and quality of our product and solution, and the technical services you lead to deliver them.

Required Education and Experience:
  • A successful Full Stack Architect with Test Automation at Crossover will demonstrate the following qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree from a top university in Computer Science, Computer Engineering.

  • At least 8 years of experience in hands-on implementation and execution of automated test strategies within various technical and functional contexts.

  • Experience developing automated UI and API test case framework.

  • Experience with Java, Python, AWS, Unix, Linux

  • Expertise industry standard frameworks and tools such Java Robot Framework/ Selenium/Cucumber/etc.

  • Expertise in defining testing automation strategies for enterprise solutions.

  • Experience in leading teams

  • Excellent understanding of current enterprise software technologies and development practices/tools, including virtual environments, source control, remote development, issue tracking, build and test automation, and networking management

You might be a great fit if:
  • You are able to engage sophisticated global customers in deep technical discussions, making them confident that you know their problem better than they do

  • You have a true “roll up the sleeves and get it done” working approach; demonstrated success as a problem solver, operating with end results in mind, self-starter

  • You are comfortable “working virtually” with teammates and customers around the world

Pay:$30/hror$60K/year

Commitment:40hours/week

Location:Global(remote)

We’re one of the few legitimate companies offering high-paying jobs that are 100% remote, work from home. You never have to fight traffic to the office again and you have the freedom to choose when and where you put in your 40 hours to be most effective each week.

However, it is important to note that while you will work as a "contractor," these are long-term contracts that should be your only source of employment. You are not permitted to work additional jobs on the side. Please do not apply unless you are available to make this position your sole employment.

Toqualify, please provide a resume/CV demonstrating the required experience and skills. From there, to help us find the top 1% of talent, there will be a series of interviews and online skills examinations. We realize these are challenging and can require a decent amount of time - so we thank you in advance for your efforts.

items.title: Software Engineer (Full Stack)
items.content:
About you

If you care about software quality but find testing and QA boring and tedious, you may be interested in helping us develop a new way.
Do you love building new stuff, learning and working with emerging technologies? Working with a team of skilled engineers with the same passion as yours and a desire to build unique and groundbreaking products?
If so, we would like to hear from you.


About us

We are SpotQA's Product Team, we're building the next generation of test automation software.
We are building the self-driving car technology for the testing world.
Our objective? To develop new technology that uses machine-learning and domain expertise with the aim of performing testing fully autonomously
To help with our mission, we are looking for a passionate Senior Software Engineer / Full-stack developer, to join our core engineering team.


REQUIREMENTS

Since we're building emerging technology, we're looking for solid engineering skills and experience. But more importantly, we are looking for can-do attitudes, a passion to learn/grow independently and willingness to delve into problems.

Ideally, we're looking for a wide variety of skills and experience, but don't be put off if you don't consider yourself an expert in every single one of these areas. If you see yourself here and share our passions, we'd still love to hear from you!

We have our eyes on a few skills, namely expertise/strong experience in the following:

Strong Java engineering skills
Linux based environments and bash scripting
Container technology (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)
VCS (e.g., Git, Mercurial) and CI (e.g., Jenkins, TravisCI, CircleCI)
Deep understanding of algorithms and data structure:
Time / complexity trade-offs of data structures, and ability to implement Trees, Graphs, and D&C algorithms
Garbage collection technology, performance tuning techniques, memory leaks, etc.
Software design patterns and passion for writing clean code
Good communication skills and ability to liaise with other teams
Building REST interfaces, use of Web-sockets
Strong JavaScript skills, along with HTML5/CSS3
Build systems (e.g., Maven, Gradle, Bazel)
Relational & NoSQL DBs (e.g., PostgresSQL, MySQL, MongoDB), and in-memory stores (e.g., Redis, Hazelcast)
Testing frameworks (e.g., JUnit, Jest)
++ Bonus Points ++

Relevant degree in computer science / software engineering
ES6 and Node.js
Vue.js or React.js, as well as Flux-based architectures (e.g., VueX or Redux)
Building web crawlers, and utilising browser automation interfaces, e.g., Selenium, Chrome Remote Debugging
Testing expertise and experience of using advanced testing techniques such as Mocking, Stubbing, etc.
Ability to describe the browser's high level architecture as well the page rendering process within
Java frameworks such as Spring, Dropwizard, etc. and/or JAX-RS API


BENEFITS

Competitive salary
Possibility of working remotely is available
Working with a fast growing multinational startup which is shaping the future of Digital QA

items.title: Learning Tapestry: QA Lead Engineer - Nearshore - Remote
items.content:
QA Lead Engineer - Nearshore - Remote

Posted Oct 26

Learning Tapestry
Headquarters: Berkeley, CA
https://jobs.enlist.io/learning_tapestry/jobs/7e96e9c0-f7b1-449c-bfa8-6bf774f368b3

About Learning Tapestry

Hi! We're Learning Tapestry. We're a 35+ person all-remote, global organization dedicated to making digital learning "just work" for educators and learners alike. We solve hard problems in complex education technology environments. We’re a triple bottom line company: we make a profit like any good business; our work makes the world better (“social impact”); and we create a healthy internal work environment for everyone who works here. For our staff we believe in flexible work locations and working arrangements. We empower all of our team members to manage their schedules and adjust as necessary. We're focused on results and impact, not locations and hours. We hire people with great technical ability, but we also expect everyone at Learning Tapestry to have a strong character and solid communication skills.

What We're Looking For

Our client list is growing quickly, so we're looking for a Quality Assurance Lead Engineer to help us deliver exceptional solutions for our clients, and to help us build a strong QA practice (and team, in the near future). The position is full-time and remote. To minimize timezone challenges, you should be available for working for at least 4 hours of your time every day with US/Eastern time zone business hours (8am - 6pm).

About You

  • You’ve got 5+ years as a QA engineer/analyst with increasing levels of responsibility throughout your career. You’ve worked on a wide variety of projects, from new development to taking over maintenance of an existing test suite.
  • You’re comfortable in a remote work environment, with team members from different time zones. You can manage your own time and are a self-starter.
  • You are experienced and fluent in the productivity tools we use, like Google Apps & Hangouts, Slack, and Harvest for time tracking.
  • You’re comfortable hiring, leading and managing a team of QA engineers. We have a couple of contracted QA people on staff now, and that could grow.
  • You have experience developing and writing test plans for large software development initiatives, and working with clients to verify signoff of delivered functionality.
  • You’ve got demonstrable experience developing new tests and maintaining test suites in Ruby (with rspec, minitest, capybara, or similar), mobile (iOS, Android or React Native), javascript (mocha, chai, jest, etc) or .NET. In an ideal case you’ve got experience with more than one of these.
  • You’ve developed and executed cross-browser testing, using Browserstack, Sauce Labs, or similar.
  • You’re comfortable with git for version control, and have used Github for reviewing pull requests.

Bonus Skills

  • You’re an especially strong candidate if you have experience writing tests for automated test frameworks like Selenium or appium, and integrating a test suite with Continuous Integration tools, and software development lifecycles using Github or Bitbucket.
  • You’ve used several issue trackers in your career, like Github issues, Asana, Jira, or Redmine and you have strong opinions about which you prefer, and why.

Please do not hesitate to apply if you do not match these requirements exactly but think you could be a good fit.

Equal Opportunity

Learning Tapestry is an equal opportunity employer and encourages individuals of all ethnic and racial backgrounds, sexual orientations, and gender identities to apply. We are also particularly interested in individuals who have lived in or worked with underserved communities such as low-income, gender nonconforming, disabled, or indigenous peoples.

Apply for this position

Fill out the online application here: https://jobs.enlist.io/learning_tapestry/jobs/7e96e9c0-f7b1-449c-bfa8-6bf774f368b3

items.title: QA Engineer
items.content:
QA Engineer
Location : Central London

Who are we

Twickets was created by music fan, Richard Davies, who made the simple observation that real
fans don’t want to rip other fans off. When we have tickets we can no longer use, most of us
don’t want to sell them for a profit. We just don’t want them to go to waste and are really happy
if we can get our money back. So Richard set up Twickets as a service on Twitter, connecting
fans and allowing them to trade with each other at strictly no more than face value.
Today, Twickets is the largest fan-to-fan marketplace for face value tickets and connects fans
via both website and app (iOS and Android) across three continents. Thousands of tickets are
listed every month for gigs, festivals, sports, comedy, theatre and the arts.
We are growing rapidly, and have attracted support from the industry through our event
partners, investors and the media. Our platform and technologies are constantly evolving as we
strive to innovate and expand into new territories.
We allow ticket resale both on a private basis and through integrations with artists, promoters,
ticket agencies, sporting organisations and venues.

Our Tech

Our backend platform is a Java stack, using Spring, CXF, Thrift, Cassandra, RabbitMQ and
Postgresql, all running on AWS. We deliver everything through web services (REST/JSON) to
the frontend system.
Frontends are written in Bootstrap / AngularJS (the main web site), Android & iOS and for
internally facing web applications, Vaadin framework.

The Role

We are looking for keen, self motivated individual to join our development team at Twickets as a
QA. Our product is a web application, its written in Angular.JS (front end) and Java (backend)
and native mobile apps for the two main mobile platforms. We currently do a combination of
testing by hand and automated testing. Each feature is developed and tested in isolation thenretested at the end of the sprint. You will work closely with the product owner throughout to
make sure that you know the stories being developed and help define acceptance criteria, you
will then test each story as soon as is has come out of code review, and complete final product
testing once all stories in the sprint are complete.
When not actively testing new features, you will be working on improving and extending our
automated test suite, implementing new types of test, all helping assure quality of our product.
Essential skills

You should be a good communicator, a team player and always improving your own skills and
those of others around you. You need to be able to quickly get up to speed with technical
concepts. You should also be strong in the following skills:

- Management of the testing process
- Functional Testing
- Exploratory Testing
- Agile Process
- Continuous Integration
- Version control systems, Git
- HTML/CSS/Javascript
- SQL Databases
Other skills and qualifications
A good degree or similar from a well regarded university or commensurate industry experience
would be beneficial. Also, experience with:
- Integration testing
- Testing mobile applications
- Testing Automation frameworks (selenium, protractor)

The Benefits

● You will be enrolled onto a workplace pension scheme
● Central London offices just off Oxford Street
● Free Kitchen with breakfast, fruit, beer fridge and refreshments
● Gig / event tickets
● Opportunity for remote working

items.title: Senior Software Engineer @ Sprinklr
items.content:
Senior Software Engineer @ Sprinklr

2017-10-23 03:15

Description

Who We Are

Sprinklr is 1,300 employees strong, valued at $1.8 billion, and one of the fastest growing companies in the history of enterprise software.

In the age of the empowered and connected customer, we know that every experience a customer has with a brand matters...a lot.

That’s why -- from the very beginning -- Sprinklr set out to build a powerful, agnostic, and first-of-its-kind “social operating system” that integrates with an organization’s existing tech infrastructure and allows employees across the front office to collaborate more effectively and deliver superior customer experiences across every social channel.

Today, we’re revolutionizing customer engagement in 75+ countries for more than 1000 of the most recognized brands, including Nike, JPMorgan Chase, Verizon, McDonald’s, Microsoft, P&G, Uber, and more than 50% of the Fortune 50.

We’ve spent the last six years building the world’s most complete enterprise social technology. Now we’re leveraging that market-leading position to help the biggest brands on the planet take on one of the largest opportunities ever in enterprise software: unifying the front office.

And we’re bringing the very best talent in the world together to get there.

What You'll Do

We are currently seeking a person with extensive development and consulting experience. Full-stack software engineers with experience in a wide variety of technologies are preferred. It is imperative that you not only know your way around various front-end and back-end architectures, but can also walk a technical or non-technical customer through the process of integrating two business systems.

In this role you will be leading customer integration activities as well as rolling up your sleeves when it’s needed.

What Are Your Responsibilities

  • Consult with internal and external customers in a highly complex technical environment
  • Provide solutions using creative problem solving, technical expertise and strong understanding of underlying business requirements and best practices.
  • Write proof-of-concept applications using available SDKs and APIs
  • Research, design and implement solutions to highly ambiguous problems
  • Provided guidance to customers who are implementing solutions using the Sprinklr API.
  • Analyze API source code and assist product and documentation teams identifying gaps in the documentation.
  • Maintain knowledge of the Sprinklr application and architecture.
  • Work closely with the Product Support, Customer Success, Client Services and Development teams to resolve application issues and plan for changes, upgrades, enhancements and new customer provisioning.
  • Document operational procedures
  • Inspire, grow and lead junior consultants
  • Follow industry trends and developments to provide new ideas and recommendations on processes and products.

Who You Are & What Makes You Qualified

  • Minimum of 6+ years of experience building scalable web based applications
  • Minimum of 3 years experience developing backend systems in Java
  • Solid understanding of web application security and vulnerabilities (such as the OWASP top 10 list).
  • Experience designing and consuming REST based API services.
  • Proficient in HTML, JavaScript (ES6), and/or CSS.
  • Familiar with source control management systems (git is preferred).
  • Experience with NoSql databases such as MongoDB and ElasticSearch
  • Experience with Message Queuing Systems such as Kafka
  • Experience with Javascript Frameworks such as Express, React, Redux
  • Experience with Spring, Spring Boot and Spring Cloud
  • Experience with Docker, AWS, Azure and deployment strategies
  • Comfortable working in a UNIX environment.
  • Experience with Social Media and CRM Integrations

While our strong preference is for this position to be in Austin TX, we recognize that great talent can be found all over and will consider remote work candidates from anywhere in the U.S.

You know You're Successful if….

You’re just as comfortable writing code as you are having a conversation with someone about writing code. The right person for this job will have extensive development experience but have more to offer than your average software engineer.

If you habitually analyze business processes and find yourself designing databases and writing APIs in your mind in order to make sense of a process you might be exactly the person we’re looking for.

Country

United States

items.title: ServiceNow Developer - Information Techology Coalition, Inc. - Remote
items.content:
ServiceNow Developer
Information Techology Coalition, Inc. -Remote
– Job Description
ITC has an opportunity for a dynamic ServiceNow Developer to support the Department of Commerce Headquarters (DOC HQ) as a sub to CSRA. The primary work location will be remote, with travel for periods of time to CSRA’s office Arlington, VA with frequent travel to DOC HQ in Washington, DC. CSRA is pursuing an opportunity at this customer that will support the creation of a DOC-wide shared services infrastructure (SSI). This role requires a dynamic contributor who can manage and configure ServiceNow applications and modules, develop new products, and perform some system administration tasks. This is a greenfield environment so candidates need to understand all aspects of the product and be experienced in implementing all modules. The role will require good customer-facing skills and outstanding written and verbal communication. In addition, the ServiceNow Developer will need to be collaborative and work closely with business analysis, testing, and support teams in implementing, testing, and supporting the solution.

Responsibilities:
Collaborate with stakeholders, business analysts, and UX analysts in interpreting requirements into ServiceNow. This will include prototyping solutions in ServiceNow. Contribute to the strategic development of new platform customizations, as needed, based on customer needs Participate in the collection and implementation of tool requirements and investigate, as necessary, to determine the best solution or configuration options available based on the specific requirement Develop detailed designs for the implementation of new products and capabilities built on ServiceNow as well as for the integration with downstream systems Participate in the design and development of a single sign-on security solution Engage in a full agile development process including detailed design, development, unit testing, and configuration management Identify, diagnose, research, track, and resolve technical issues within the platform & user work flows. Manages accounts/groups and their memberships within ServiceNow Provides assistance with report configuration and maintenance, as needed Performs operational administrative tasks, as needed Actively collaborates with other teammates to perform code reviews and discuss new developments and projects Produce all required deliverables

Requirements:
Qualifications:
Years of Experience: 8 years of IT experience with at least 3 years of direct ServiceNow experienceRequired Education: Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Systems Engineering, or equivalent; Master’s degree preferredRequired Certification: ServiceNow Certified System AdministratorDesired Certification: ServiceNow Certified Application Developer, Certified Implementation SpecialistExpert in understanding and developing on the core ServiceNow platform, including administration, support, break/fix and API’s.Experienced in developing user friendly catalog items with experience writing orchestration workflows such as Content Management, LDAP, Web Services, Active Directory and Custom ActivitiesMust understand best practices and proper implementations of the ServiceNow platform.Must demonstrate analytical and initiative taking abilities, while being self-motivated with a strong customer focus.Experienced with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS; Java/JEE experience highly preferredAbility to work and deliver high quality services in a demanding environment under aggressive deadlinesExperienced working in an Agile lifecycleOutstanding written and verbal communication skillsPermanent Residency or US Citizenship RequiredMust be eligible for a Public Trust Clearance

items.title: ServiceNow Developer - Information Techology Coalition, Inc. - Remote
items.content:
ServiceNow Developer
Information Techology Coalition, Inc. -Remote
– Job Description
ITC has an opportunity for a dynamic ServiceNow Developer to support the Department of Commerce Headquarters (DOC HQ) as a sub to CSRA. The primary work location will be remote, with travel for periods of time to CSRA’s office Arlington, VA with frequent travel to DOC HQ in Washington, DC. CSRA is pursuing an opportunity at this customer that will support the creation of a DOC-wide shared services infrastructure (SSI). This role requires a dynamic contributor who can manage and configure ServiceNow applications and modules, develop new products, and perform some system administration tasks. This is a greenfield environment so candidates need to understand all aspects of the product and be experienced in implementing all modules. The role will require good customer-facing skills and outstanding written and verbal communication. In addition, the ServiceNow Developer will need to be collaborative and work closely with business analysis, testing, and support teams in implementing, testing, and supporting the solution.

items.title: Senior Software Engineer
items.content:
Location: Flexible (Boston preferred)


For candidates interested in working remotely, you bring demonstrated experience and previous success working remotely


Position is available: August 2017


THE OPPORTUNITY


Now that ANet is more than ten years old, the Engineering Team is redesigning many of our existing Java-based software systems. We started with our content creation platform, which is used to design student assessments. We recently went into production with a new stack of Go-based microservices. We are now working on revamping the system that delivers this content to students, as well as reporting the results.


Reporting to the Director of Engineering, this Senior Software Engineer will play a key role in crafting and implementing our technology vision for the organization.  The ideal candidate will be passionate about cutting-edge development and best practices and able to work across the stack. We are looking for a flexible and adaptable engineer with some of the following skills and/or enthusiasm for learning and growing in these areas:



  • Server-side development using Java and/or Go programming languages to build scalable, RESTful web services.

  • Data-focused engineering in both SQL and NoSQL (Mongo) environments.

  • Maintain and improve existing Data warehouse and ETL processes.

  • Design, promote, and implement data infrastructures that adhere to responsible data management principles.

  • Design and implement sustainable DevOps using AWS.


ANet is flexible to remote working with appropriate experience and a history of successfully mentoring other developers remotely. Occasional travel to ANet’s National Office in Boston will be necessary, so proximity to the New England area and eastern time zone is preferable.


WHAT YOU’LL DO



  • Play a leadership role in designing, implementing and deploying sustainable code for substantial features and systems.

  • Implement ANet’s next generation of technology products that support data-driven educational practices and help to close the achievement gap in the underserved communities we partner with.

  • Create, monitor and deliver against the product road map and corresponding release cycles (as negotiated with the Product Management Team).

  • Provide strategic leadership in setting goals and measuring progress in RESTful server-side APIs and/or agile, componentized client-side code.

  • Help manage, improve, and automate our deployment frameworks.

  • Keep abreast of new technologies and propose adoption as appropriate.

  • Mentor and support the development of junior developers as appropriate.

  • Actively embrace and model best practices such as code reviews, unit testing, and planning/scoping/vetting larger features.

  • Proactively look for ways to build our team through individual contributions which help us improve code quality, team culture, and team velocity.


WHO YOU ARE AND WHAT YOU BRING


In order to be successful in this role, candidates must demonstrate the following:



  • You have direct experience in many of the following:




    • Java and/or Go programming language

    • Scrum or other Agile development processes

    • RESTful Web Services

    • Cloud-based data services, preferably with both SQL and NoSQL implementations

    • Cloud-based infrastructure on AWS, including continuous integration and deployment




  • You are a team player who motivates and educates colleagues; you enjoy working in a highly collaborative and agile culture.

  • You are skilled in working closely with business partners to build technology solutions that meet the usability and functional needs of both internal and external users.

  • You operate comfortably among a highly independent staff with diverse backgrounds.

  • You bring an innovative approach to analyze, evaluate and solve problems.

  • You have a passionate commitment to and a sense of urgency for the support of schools, along with a belief that all students can achieve at high levels.

  • You are motivated by working in an environment where we live out our core values daily and are eager to examine personal archetypes and biases while discussing topics related to race, class, and privilege which relate to ANet’s Advance Equity and People Matter values.


Preferred Qualifications:



  • 4+ years of software development experience

  • A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related degree



ANet is committed to maximizing the diversity of our organization. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage individuals of all ethnic and racial backgrounds and gender identities to apply to our positions.
